Description
Do you want to build a career that is truly worthwhile? Working at the World Bank Group provides a unique opportunity for you to help our clients solve their greatest development challenges. The World Bank Group is one of the largest sources of funding and knowledge for developing countries; a unique global partnership of five institutions dedicated to ending extreme poverty, increasing shared prosperity and promoting sustainable development. With 189 member countries and more than 120 offices worldwide, we work with public and private sector partners, investing in groundbreaking projects and using data, research, and technology to develop solutions to the most urgent global challenges. For more information, visit www.worldbank.org

The 25 Executive Directors of the World Bank Group (WBG Board), assisted by their Alternates, Senior Advisors, Advisors, and Administrative staff, represent the interests of the 189-member countries who nominated or elected them. They also ensure the oversight of the general operations of the Bank Group and the group’s results on the ground. The institutions under their purview are: The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD), the International Development Association (IDA), which together form the World Bank; the International Finance Corporation (IFC); the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA); and the International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes (ICSID). The World Bank Group is one of the world's largest sources of funding and knowledge for developing countries. The Board, working closely with Management, approves policies, financial commitments, and knowledge products that ensure the best global expertise and help generate cutting-edge results for its clients in developing countries.

The WBG Board of Executive Directors considers and decides on the proposals made by the President of the WBG as they relate to IBRD loans and guarantees, IDA credits and grants, IFC investments, and MIGA guarantees; and endorse the strategies and policies that impact the World Bank's general operations. Executive Directors are also responsible for conveying the interests and concerns of their Constituency members to the Board and the Bank’s management, as well as the interests and concerns of the Bank to their Constituency.

The Office of the Executive Director (ED) for Benin, Burkina Faso, Cabo Verde, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Congo (Democratic Republic of), Congo (Republic of), Cote d'Ivoire, Djibouti, Equatorial Guinea, Gabon, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Madagascar, Mali, Mauritania, Mauritius, Niger, Sao Tome and Principe, Senegal, Togo constituency (EDS13) is looking for a Research Analyst to assist the Office of the Executive Director in analytical duties. Please see below for further details.

In addition to the Executive Director, the office consists of an Alternate Executive Director, Senior Advisors, Advisors, and four other administrative support staff.

The successful candidate will report to the Executive Director and work in Washington, DC.

Note:
This position is for a 2-year Term. Any staff on an open-ended appointment who is selected is strongly advised to obtain a re-entry guarantee from his/her releasing unit to enable return to open-ended status. An open-ended staff who does not have a re-entry to his/her releasing unit acknowledges that by applying to this position, s/he is entering a Term position if selected and will not be able to maintain his/her open-ended status in the ED office.

The staff will be subject to a performance review per the WBG annual performance review processes.

Roles & Responsibility:

The main responsibilities of the successful candidate will be to collect and analyze data to allow constituency countries to fully contribute to the elaboration of strategies and programs financed and sponsored by the World Bank Group.
The Analyst will assist the Executive Director in managing interactions across the WBG’s entities, the Regional and Sectoral VPUs, and other EDs, as well as with constituency members and external partners, to identify relevant sources of information that allow the performance of relevant, data-driven analysis and ensures countries to proactively contribute to the elaboration of projects and programs. The work includes but is not limited to research on the economic situation of various countries, update of economic and development indicators, and maintenance of the dashboards to assist the ED in deploying his/her strategic plan to increase financing and advisory services and exploit the MFD (Maximizing Finance for Development) approach to benefit the economies of the countries in the ED’s constituency.

Working with the Executive Director, Alternate Executive Director (AED), Senior Advisors, Advisors, and Assistants on a range of tasks, including:
Identify, gather, and analyze data to produce high-quality reports and other outputs that meet the needs of the Office.

Coordinate the preparation of periodic analyses and information reports for constituency authorities and management as assigned by the ED or AED.

Support the Office in maintaining the official website and conducting the research to support Office activities and presentations.

Participate in meetings and events, and prepare materials as assigned by the ED or AED.

Assist in preparing briefing materials, presentations, and talking points for the ED in his interactions with the countries, the Executive Board, and various partners.

Provide high-quality support to the Executive Director/Alternate Executive Director and Senior Advisors/Advisors in a multicultural environment.

Liaise with appropriate contacts in the capitals of the constituency to gather and manage information, indicators and development strategies to build and regularly update a dashboard for each country to help implement the office strategy.

Handle ad hoc duties assigned by the ED and AED.

Selection Criteria
Must have a Master’s degree (e.g., in Economics, Finance, Banking, Business Administration, or related discipline) and a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience.
Experience working in or on issues related to the Western and Central Africa Region.
Ability to conduct research, analyze, and propose solutions to support strategic goals.
Knowledge and understanding of the functions and operations of the WBG.
Highly skilled in information technology and digital platforms. Skills in graphic design are an added advantage.
Strong written and oral communication skills with the ability to summarize issues into oral and written briefs in English and French.
Must have attention to detail and follow-through.
Strong team player with the ability to work independently and in a diverse team.
Ability to work effectively in a multicultural environment and strong interpersonal skills. Proficiency in French is required.
Ability to independently manage multiple assignments with minimal supervision, prioritizing and coordinating team members under tight deadlines.
Willingness to accept personal ownership and accountability for meeting deadlines and achieving results.
Awareness of relevant internal and external factors and their impact on the constituency countries.
Willingness to work long hours and availability to travel when needed.
Required Competencies
Technology and systems knowledge - Has advanced proficiency in the latest technology relevant to assigned responsibilities. Demonstrates initiative in learning and supporting the implementation of emerging technology and systems pertinent to the effective work of the unit.
Project and task management - Able to organize, coordinate, monitor, and implement tasks and projects. Demonstrates ownership and accountability for results. Demonstrates innovation and creativity in promoting effectiveness.
Institutional policies, processes, and procedures - Demonstrates in-depth, and up-to-date knowledge of administrative and policy guidelines, practices, products, and services in the area of assigned functional responsibility; can guide others in complex situations.
Versatility and adaptability - Able to anticipate, facilitate and catalyze change in the business environment and accurately assess the need for new skills and knowledge. Demonstrates continued learning attitude, supporting others in their learning and change management efforts.
World Bank Group Core Competencies
The World Bank Group offers comprehensive benefits, including a retirement plan; medical, life and disability insurance; and paid leave, including parental leave, as well as reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities.
We are proud to be an equal opportunity and inclusive employer with a dedicated and committed workforce, and do not discriminate based on gender, gender identity, religion, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or disability.
Learn more about working at the World Bank and IFC, including our values and inspiring stories.

Employer Name:
The SEED School of Washington D.C.
2.7
Description:
About SEED:
The mission of SEED schools is to prepare scholars academically, socially, and emotionally, for success in and beyond college in a public, college-prep, boarding school setting.

The SEED Public Charter School of Washington D.C. (SEED DC) opened in 1998 as the nation’s first urban public college preparatory boarding school. SEED DC empowers over 250 scholars in grades 9-12 to achieve their full potential within our 24-hour learning environment and exposure opportunities. All SEED scholars live on campus between Sunday evenings and Friday afternoons.

Our innovative model integrates a rigorous academic program with a nurturing boarding program that teaches life skills and provides a safe and secure environment. This boarding school model provides a comprehensive solution to the challenges facing urban youth and serves as a prototype for expansion nationwide. Our model has proven successful: over 90 percent of SEED graduates have been accepted to four-year colleges and universities throughout the country and over 60 percent remain enrolled in college or already have earned college degrees.

* More information can be found on the school’s website: www.seedschooldc.org

Position Overview:
The Data Analyst is responsible for coordinating the effective management of data and data collection systems and ensuring integration between different programs and data systems for system-wide use.

The Data Analyst will also serve as the POC to support and monitor the preparation of data submission, statistical reports on educational activities for government and educational agencies (OSSE & DCPCSB) through different information systems (Powerschool, Quickbase, Qlik Sense, SunGuard K-12, Socrata).

The Data Analyst will also develop standard templates for reporting and analysis to drive data driven practices. The dashboard as it exists is a collection of data tables, charts and analysis that provides a picture of how the school is performing as a whole and towards key indicators of success. The dashboard consolidates all relevant data from various school departments as a measure of effectiveness in key organizational areas
.
The Data Analyst would be expected to be part of some executive meetings to offer suggestions on improving data collection, deep diving student achievement and modifying the data dashboard as needed.

The Data Analyst get practical experience in all areas related to data analyst and database administration with a focus on basic concepts in year one like PowerSchool and more advanced visualization analyst skills like Qlik Sense in year 2. Additionally, The Data Analyst will get practical experience in assisting HOS and senior leadership team to explore data and discover insights.


Areas of Responsibility & Accountability:
Support student information systems (SIS), eSchoolPLUS, and CRDC, including collection and management of student data,
Ensure SIS data is accurate and up-to-date; perform regularly scheduled data checks and identify data errors; correct data errors or manage a process for data corrections with supervision,
Validate data that is sent to the Public Charter School Board (PCSB) and Office of the State Superintendent of Education (OSSE) including Performance Management Framework (PMF) data,
Provide ongoing data analysis for instructional team in a timely fashion to support instructional resource allocation,
Maintain and manage student, teacher and organizational data for each school.
Aggregate and organize Business Intelligence visualized data for HOS, senior leadership, teachers, and students as per “Data System Plan.”
Identify and source educational technology, implement, establish /track metrics and train staff on correct usage,
Provide competent tier 1 support to network users - answer basic computing questions, identify tools to solve problems or streamline processes under the supervision of Office of the State Superintendent of Education.
Data systems and technology project management:
Work with appropriate stakeholders to create system-wide protocols for the collection, storage, management, reporting and quality control of organizational data,
Roll out a new data dashboard by collecting data from various departments, input data on a common spreadsheet (Excel) as well as Qlik Sense,
Perform analysis on complex data sets to provide meaningful information, evaluate data for structural integrity and consistency, understands data and extract information to meet business requirements, as well as identify trends/anomalies in the data collected to understand the source of data inaccuracies,
Collaborate with staff on interpreting data and using it to improve student achievement,
Support the development of key data management and analysis initiatives across the organization and the technology needed to support these initiatives.
Skills & Qualities Sought:
Bachelor’s degree required; Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification or significant experience in a project based, consulting environment is highly preferred.
Understanding of and a passion for educational technology and leading edge technology solutions.
Proven skills in quantitative data management and analysis.
Team-player capable of working both collaboratively and independently.
Customer focused approach, interpersonal flexibility and ability to multi-task.
Self-starter and demonstrated resourcefulness.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Strong judgment and collaborative decision-making skills.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; ability to present and effectively explain technology solutions to staff in non-technical jargon.

Knowledge & Expertise:
Familiarity with PowerSchool, Qlik Sense, eSchoolPlus, QuickBase, ADT mapping, OCDB or other information systems and data visualization tool a plus.
Ability to synthesize information from multiple sources.
Ability to understand the strengths, weaknesses, and limitations of given datasets or metrics,
Knowledge of the K-12 education field, including familiarity with current student assessment and accountability practices (preferred),
Experience supporting projectors: configuration, setup, maintenance, troubleshooting,
Strong ability/understanding of MYSQL/Oracle SQL Developer - can design complex query statements to obtain data.
Experience in Business Intelligence - gathering and interpreting data from multiple sources.
Experience tracking school equipment - laptops, A/V media, projectors, cell phones, etc.
General experience with security systems - Ccure, access card readers, castle cards, cameras/dvrs a plus.
Experience maintaining inventory - replacement parts, printer toners, staff supplies.
Basic understanding of network principals – WAN’s, LAN’s, WAP’s, VLANS, etc.
Light system administration experience with MS Server, VMware 4.x, and common server side applications.

A SEED Employee:
Is committed to SEED’s mission and its beliefs;
Thinks strategically in aligning one’s own work streams to the larger organizational mission;
Possesses exceptional interpersonal skills, with creative and positive energy for working with youth;
Behaves professionally in a fast-paced environment and with a variety of constituents;
Works independently as well as collaboratively with a team while managing multiple tasks.

This position description may not describe all duties, responsibilities and skills associated with this position. It is intended to portray the major aspects of the job and is not meant to be all inclusive. Other duties or skills may be required.

NOTE: On Sept. 20, 2021, Mayor Muriel Bowser signed Mayor’s Order 2021-109 requiring that by Nov. 1, 2021 all adults who are regularly in schools and child care facilities in the District must have received a full course of vaccination against COVID-19. A full course of vaccination means an individual must have received the second dose of a 2-dose series, or one dose of a single-dose series effective Nov. 1, 2021. This Order does not permit a test-out option for individuals unless they have been granted a medical or religious exemption. More information can be found here.

Why Work Here?
Our mission to achieve universal service addresses America’s current critical needs to build out broadband capabilities for telehealth, online learning, and keeping families connected. Join us and help USAC accomplish our mission to bridge the digital divide. Through its administration of the $10 billion Universal Service Fund (USF) programs on behalf of the FCC, USAC works to promote the availability of quality services at just, reasonable and affordable rates and to increase access to advanced telecommunications services throughout the nation. Additional information on USF programs can be found at: https://www.usac.org/about/
Benefits
USAC supports our employees well beyond their salary with a system of benefits that rivals the top organizations in the country. Simply put: if you are committed to improving the lives of others, we are committed to improving yours. USAC provides low-premium, top-of-the-line medical, dental, and vision insurance in addition to disability and life coverage. Generous 401k contribution, Federal and floating holidays, paid sick leave and vacation time that increases every year. Regular telework schedule and opportunities to take professional development courses and training.
A Multicultural Team
We have actively built an organization that doesn’t just celebrate our diversity; we depend on it. The challenges of achieving universal service require creative and unique perspectives. Our accepting and inclusive community will challenge you to grow and learn from others while always recognizing the value of your contribution.
USAC employees are passionate about our mission. Our work contributes to the success of all Americans. We’ve worked together to build a culture that is collaborative, ambitious, outcome-oriented, and feedback-focused.
As USAC continues to support universal service impacting health care providers, educators, and consumers, it is critical now more than ever that we hire people equally passionate and committed to helping fulfill our mission. We are currently seeking an experienced, dynamic and collaborative professional to serve as a Data Analyst on our Lifeline team. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Program Management you will:
perform data reporting and analytics, including requirements gathering for reports, aggregating and presenting information from various programmatic data sources for monthly and quarterly reporting purposes.
This is an outstanding career opportunity for an individual interested in a genuine professional challenge in support of a public-spirited mission.

Working in a creative and fast-paced environment, the Data Analyst will develop and produce reports for USAC’s programs, USAC’s business units, and external stakeholders, such as the FCC and telecommunication carriers. Among others, your responsibilities will include the following:
Analyze large sets of program data to identify opportunities to improve the efficiency, integrity, and stakeholder experience of Universal Service program participants.
Perform research and analysis using programmatic data, to relay programmatic impacts, trends, patterns, statistics, etc. across the company.
Recommend program process improvements based on data while maintaining reporting standards while ensuring consistency and quality of deliverables.
Create and maintain queries using SQL or other programming languages (with a preference for Open Source programming languages such as R and Python) as necessary for consistency and efficiency of data retrieval from various systems.
Research methods and tools to create efficiency for reporting, GIS mapping, and other analytical and computational processes.
Design and develop data visualizations using Tableau and other software applications to present program insights, analysis and issues.
Maintain, develop, and implement policies and procedures that ensure the accuracy and integrity of USAC program data and reporting.
Participate in the evaluation of new technologies to ensure the technology architecture and data analysis and visualization tools are in line with company’s evolving business intelligence needs.
Support managers, directors, and members of the leadership team in various projects, as needed.
Other specific duties as assigned.
About You

The successful candidate will excel at operating in a diverse and fluid environment, and will be crucial for the success of the Data Strategy Team.
You possess Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in a related field.
You have experience in the data science field performing descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analysis and developing data products and tools that provide actionable insights and strategic guidance to managers and people in leadership positions.
You have the ability to work independently, but also collaborate and work across other departments as needed.
You have proven experience working with data warehouse in databases using SQL and programming languages for data science such as R or Python (or a demonstrated capacity to learn them).
You have experience presenting complex analysis and results in plain English for a non-technical audience using data visualizations (i.e. charts, tables, and graphs) on various software platforms.
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, are naturally curious and inquisitive, and are interested in continuously improving our work.
Strongly Preferred Qualifications - background in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or Quantitative skills.

USAC is committed to providing a safe and healthy workplace for all employees. All offers of employment with USAC are conditioned on completing and passing a background and reference check. USAC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. No agencies please.

About Management Leadership For Tomorrow (MLT)
Management Leadership for Tomorrow (MLT) is a national nonprofit that is transforming the most influential organizations in the U.S. by providing them with winning DEI strategies, standards, and tactics while equipping high-achieving Black, Hispanic / Latinx, and Native American talent with skills, coaching, and door-opening relationships to accelerate their paths to leadership.

While MLT is a national non-profit, we have a very commercial focus with significant rigor in how we implement and sustain our vision; and a high “performance bar” for talent that ensures we engage exceptional teammates who are aligned with our values and match the organization’s mission.

The Opportunity We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst to help develop MLT’s insights on advancing racial equity and socioeconomic mobility. The Senior Data Analyst will work with members of the Insights Team and key internal partners to munge, analyze, model, and interpret data to answer key questions that advance our insights agenda. A successful candidate will be insatiably curious and analytically rigorous. They will have a track record of solving complex problems and bring a strong analytical toolkit. with experience coding in R or Python. This person will be eager to develop new skills to tackle complex social problems. This individual will be skilled in driving work autonomously and able to successfully function in a high-paced environment while juggling multiple priorities
Responsibilities:
Utilize appropriate statistical methods to analyze data and derive insights
Manage large datasets and perform data quality checks to ensure the validity of analyses
Build scalable and reproducible work in Python or R including data ingestion, quality checks, cleaning, analysis, modeling, and output
Summarize and disseminate findings to internal stakeholders, utilizing effective writing and data visualization
Prepare high-quality presentations and data visualizations to communicate strategic insights to internal stakeholders
Requirements:
Bachelors in mathematics, statistics, data science, or social science
3-5 years of professional experience programming statistical analyses in SPSS, Stata, Python or R (Python and R highly preferred)
2-4 years of professional experience with quantitative analysis
Strong data visualization skills
Strong process orientation - motivated to instill sustainable/scalable processes and templates
Ability to work independently, handle multiple tasks simultaneously, and meet deadlines
Commitment to the social sector and MLT’s mission and values
MLT is committed to providing a safe and healthy workplace, and to modeling the highest degree of health standards for our Fellows, our Partners, and the communities we serve. We expect all MLT employees and contractors to be fully vaccinated - including the booster regimen - against the coronavirus (COVID-19), in accordance with ADA accommodations. Visitors to MLT’s office in the District of Columbia, Maryland, and Virginia (DMV) locations or remote work sites should also expect to comply with this requirement.

Please apply to a position with MLT ONLY if you are willing and able to prove that you are fully vaccinated against the coronavirus, regardless of work location.

In this role, you will have the ability to work well and collaborate within a team and excel in a fast-paced, client intensive environment.

About you:

About DDC:
Since our founding in 1996, DDC has grown to become the largest full-service Public Affairs agency in the country. Through our unique blend of professional services and technology solutions, we establish rich connections with targeted audiences and empower our clients to build the relationships necessary to win on their public policy campaigns. We are committed to ensuring each member of our team is a key contributor, and support that by fostering a collaborative work environment and entrepreneurial spirit throughout the organization.
DDC is proud to be part of the Omnicom Group Inc. (www.omnicomgroup.com). Omnicom is a leading global marketing and corporate communications company. Omnicom’s branded networks and numerous specialty firms provide advertising, strategic media planning and buying, digital and interactive marketing, direct and promotional marketing, public relations, and other specialty communications services to over 5,000 clients in more than 100 countries.

Agency information and submission requirements:

We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our Analytics and Optimization Area.
When you come work with us, here’s what you’ll find:
Work that is meaningful. We are a fast-paced, deadline-driven consulting firm that only works with nonprofit clients who are essential to advancing the cause of justice, alleviating suffering, and solving the greatest challenges we face.
Commitment to Anti-Racism, Equity, and Inclusion (AEI). We envision an anti-oppressive workplace that ensures an inclusive employee experience, promotes equitable outcomes for staff, and supports clients to center accessibility and anti-racism in their programs.
Colleagues you can count on. Kind, dedicated, passionate people who work collaboratively to get things done and help you do your best.
An organization that embraces change. We strive to improve and adapt and always seek new ways that we can contribute to a just, inclusive, and sustainable world. We are also continually working on making M+R a better place for our staff.
So that’s us. Now about the work:
We run digital fundraising, membership, and advocacy programs for our clients, which include lots of politically progressive groups like Planned Parenthood, League of Conservation Voters, and PETA, as well as cultural organizations we love, like the American Museum of Natural History. And our clients also include organizations that are working in the most dire situations in the world such as the International Rescue Committee.
Day-to-day, we’re using data to answer the fundamental questions and tackle the complicated challenges our clients face.
Here’s what you’ll be doing in this role:
Work with account teams to produce reports and analyses such as: return on investment analyses, retention analyses, testing analyses and other campaign reporting.
Develop custom reporting dashboards (fundraising, social, news, ads, etc), including managing data collection processes and procedures.
Assist with our annual Benchmarks report: collecting, analyzing, and proofing data.
Train and support new staff in the basics of reporting and analysis, and provide ad hoc support in Excel, Google Sheets, and other products.
Do your part to help us run smoothly, including carefully tracking all of your hours.
Skills and experiences required for this role:
4-5 years of work experience in data analysis, with at least 2 years of experience in marketing, advertising, or eCommerce, including familiarity with testing.
Proficiency in manipulating and analyzing data in both Excel and SQL.
Prior experience with non-profits or political/issue campaigns.
Proven ability to break down complex data problems into smart, logical processes.
Ability to identify and gather all requirements at the outset of a project.
Ability to annotate data deliverables and communicate your thinking and processes to others.
Skills and experiences we expect of all M+R employees:
Demonstrated commitment to anti-racism, equity, and inclusion.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively to gain trust and give respect to others through honesty, integrity, kindness, empathy, and authenticity.

Proven track record to successfully pick up new skills, including learning new technologies.
Drive to seek what can be improved and offer ways to fix any potential roadblocks.

Strong ability to relay your ideas clearly verbally and in writing.
Skills and experiences that are preferred, but not required:
Experience with R, Google Analytics, Tableau.
Experience designing and evaluating A/B tests.
Salary and benefits:
This is an exempt, unionized position, represented by the Washington-Baltimore News Guild. The salary for this position is $83,830. As part of M+R’s commitment to compensation equity and transparency, we have a no negotiation policy. Salary negotiations can introduce bias and perpetuate wage inequality. Staff at M+R who successfully meet their performance expectations have regular opportunities for promotion with accompanying increases in compensation.

We also offer a generous benefits package:

Three weeks vacation as well as 15 paid sick days and three personal days;
Medical, dental, and vision benefits with premiums fully paid for by M+R for individual employees;
401(k) plan with employer match;
Quarterly discretionary profit-sharing contributions;
Flexible work schedules and the option to work remotely anywhere within the United States and its territories with broadband internet;
Annual $1,000 professional development stipend;
Flexible Spending Accounts for medical, dependent care, and transit.
The fine print:

M+R staff have the option to be fully remote within the United States, or work from one of the following M+R office locations:

1101 Connecticut Ave NW, Washington, DC
11 Park Place, New York, NY
262 Washington St, Boston, MA
1611 Telegraph Ave, Oakland, CA

Staff working from an M+R office are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19, and all staff will be asked to provide information regarding their vaccine status.

To apply, use the button on this page. No calls please.

Our Hiring Process:

We aim to be transparent and efficient in our hiring process. Each question you will be asked throughout our hiring process ties directly back to one of the skills and experiences listed above. In each interview, you will be asked to provide examples of these skills and experiences or how you would draw on your experience to handle a scenario commonly found at M+R. Our typical hiring process includes:

1) Phone Interview
2) Written Skills Assessment
3) Video Interview(s)
4) Reference Check

Depending on logistics and scheduling, our hiring process generally takes about 4-5 weeks from phone interview to a job offer. We let candidates know after each step in the process, once we’ve made a decision, whether they are moving forward to the next stage or not, so candidates know the status of their application. If you need accommodations for this application process or any of the hiring process steps listed above, please email accommodations@mrss.com or call 202-681-8743.

M+R is an equal opportunity employer and all applicants will be considered. As a firm we are committed to being an anti-racist, equitable, and inclusive organization where all staff feel welcomed, valued, and empowered, resulting in meaningful, rewarding, and enriching experiences throughout their careers here. We work to center our AEI values in all aspects of our work, so our culture, clientele, policies, and practices are reflective and affirming of people - inclusive of their race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, immigration status, citizenship status, and so much more. We strongly encourage folks from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

Employer Name:
The SEED School of Washington D.C.
2.7
Description:
About SEED:
The mission of SEED schools is to prepare scholars academically, socially, and emotionally, for success in and beyond college in a public, college-prep, boarding school setting.

The SEED Public Charter School of Washington D.C. (SEED DC) opened in 1998 as the nation’s first urban public college preparatory boarding school. SEED DC empowers over 250 scholars in grades 9-12 to achieve their full potential within our 24-hour learning environment and exposure opportunities. All SEED scholars live on campus between Sunday evenings and Friday afternoons.

Our innovative model integrates a rigorous academic program with a nurturing boarding program that teaches life skills and provides a safe and secure environment. This boarding school model provides a comprehensive solution to the challenges facing urban youth and serves as a prototype for expansion nationwide. Our model has proven successful: over 90 percent of SEED graduates have been accepted to four-year colleges and universities throughout the country and over 60 percent remain enrolled in college or already have earned college degrees.

* More information can be found on the school’s website: www.seedschooldc.org

Position Overview:
The Data Analyst is responsible for coordinating the effective management of data and data collection systems and ensuring integration between different programs and data systems for system-wide use.

The Data Analyst will also serve as the POC to support and monitor the preparation of data submission, statistical reports on educational activities for government and educational agencies (OSSE & DCPCSB) through different information systems (Powerschool, Quickbase, Qlik Sense, SunGuard K-12, Socrata).

The Data Analyst will also develop standard templates for reporting and analysis to drive data driven practices. The dashboard as it exists is a collection of data tables, charts and analysis that provides a picture of how the school is performing as a whole and towards key indicators of success. The dashboard consolidates all relevant data from various school departments as a measure of effectiveness in key organizational areas
.
The Data Analyst would be expected to be part of some executive meetings to offer suggestions on improving data collection, deep diving student achievement and modifying the data dashboard as needed.

The Data Analyst get practical experience in all areas related to data analyst and database administration with a focus on basic concepts in year one like PowerSchool and more advanced visualization analyst skills like Qlik Sense in year 2. Additionally, The Data Analyst will get practical experience in assisting HOS and senior leadership team to explore data and discover insights.


Areas of Responsibility & Accountability:
Support student information systems (SIS), eSchoolPLUS, and CRDC, including collection and management of student data,
Ensure SIS data is accurate and up-to-date; perform regularly scheduled data checks and identify data errors; correct data errors or manage a process for data corrections with supervision,
Validate data that is sent to the Public Charter School Board (PCSB) and Office of the State Superintendent of Education (OSSE) including Performance Management Framework (PMF) data,
Provide ongoing data analysis for instructional team in a timely fashion to support instructional resource allocation,
Maintain and manage student, teacher and organizational data for each school.
Aggregate and organize Business Intelligence visualized data for HOS, senior leadership, teachers, and students as per “Data System Plan.”
Identify and source educational technology, implement, establish /track metrics and train staff on correct usage,
Provide competent tier 1 support to network users - answer basic computing questions, identify tools to solve problems or streamline processes under the supervision of Office of the State Superintendent of Education.
Data systems and technology project management:
Work with appropriate stakeholders to create system-wide protocols for the collection, storage, management, reporting and quality control of organizational data,
Roll out a new data dashboard by collecting data from various departments, input data on a common spreadsheet (Excel) as well as Qlik Sense,
Perform analysis on complex data sets to provide meaningful information, evaluate data for structural integrity and consistency, understands data and extract information to meet business requirements, as well as identify trends/anomalies in the data collected to understand the source of data inaccuracies,
Collaborate with staff on interpreting data and using it to improve student achievement,
Support the development of key data management and analysis initiatives across the organization and the technology needed to support these initiatives.
Skills & Qualities Sought:
Bachelor’s degree required; Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification or significant experience in a project based, consulting environment is highly preferred.
Understanding of and a passion for educational technology and leading edge technology solutions.
Proven skills in quantitative data management and analysis.
Team-player capable of working both collaboratively and independently.
Customer focused approach, interpersonal flexibility and ability to multi-task.
Self-starter and demonstrated resourcefulness.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Strong judgment and collaborative decision-making skills.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; ability to present and effectively explain technology solutions to staff in non-technical jargon.

Knowledge & Expertise:
Familiarity with PowerSchool, Qlik Sense, eSchoolPlus, QuickBase, ADT mapping, OCDB or other information systems and data visualization tool a plus.
Ability to synthesize information from multiple sources.
Ability to understand the strengths, weaknesses, and limitations of given datasets or metrics,
Knowledge of the K-12 education field, including familiarity with current student assessment and accountability practices (preferred),
Experience supporting projectors: configuration, setup, maintenance, troubleshooting,
Strong ability/understanding of MYSQL/Oracle SQL Developer - can design complex query statements to obtain data.
Experience in Business Intelligence - gathering and interpreting data from multiple sources.
Experience tracking school equipment - laptops, A/V media, projectors, cell phones, etc.
General experience with security systems - Ccure, access card readers, castle cards, cameras/dvrs a plus.
Experience maintaining inventory - replacement parts, printer toners, staff supplies.
Basic understanding of network principals – WAN’s, LAN’s, WAP’s, VLANS, etc.
Light system administration experience with MS Server, VMware 4.x, and common server side applications.

A SEED Employee:
Is committed to SEED’s mission and its beliefs;
Thinks strategically in aligning one’s own work streams to the larger organizational mission;
Possesses exceptional interpersonal skills, with creative and positive energy for working with youth;
Behaves professionally in a fast-paced environment and with a variety of constituents;
Works independently as well as collaboratively with a team while managing multiple tasks.

This position description may not describe all duties, responsibilities and skills associated with this position. It is intended to portray the major aspects of the job and is not meant to be all inclusive. Other duties or skills may be required.

NOTE: On Sept. 20, 2021, Mayor Muriel Bowser signed Mayor’s Order 2021-109 requiring that by Nov. 1, 2021 all adults who are regularly in schools and child care facilities in the District must have received a full course of vaccination against COVID-19. A full course of vaccination means an individual must have received the second dose of a 2-dose series, or one dose of a single-dose series effective Nov. 1, 2021. This Order does not permit a test-out option for individuals unless they have been granted a medical or religious exemption. More information can be found here.

Job Description:
Aireco Supply, Inc., a leading HVAC/R distributor located in Laurel, MD is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to manage database administration that supports sales and marketing programs.
To be successful in this position the candidate should possess proven experience with SQL querying and database maintenance and administration. This role requires great attention to detail and experience in database modification and development. The Data Analyst will assist team members and management in developing, enhancing, and maintaining standard processes, reports, databases, and reference data to support accurate, consistent, efficient data tracking for internal and external customers and marketing programs. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, with impeccable attention to detail and strong documentation and communication skills.
Responsabilities:
Develop and maintain a variety of internal customized database applications to manage sales and marketing programs.
Organize and format data for efficient query and storage processes; and create automation for repeating database tasks.
Create and manage database reports, forms, tables, queries and visualizations.
Develop and maintain an accurate database of customer information to support program tracking and reporting.
Interact with marketing and sales teams to support data management and visualization.
Uses various software applications, such as spreadsheets and relational databases to create and compile data for reporting and analysis.
Works within company ERP software to pull data and pricing that supports tracking and analysis of sales programs and marketing initiatives.
Work cross-functionally to create an insightful analysis of data for sales and marketing to support program and business development.
Process monthly concessions and SPQs for key product lines.
Develop and maintain dealer price sheets for equipment product lines to support customer program pricing structures.
Update pricing records for dealer programs and promotions using ERP software.
Assist Director of Marketing with dealer program enrollment and creating processes to track sales and marketing initiatives
Complete ad hoc projects, reporting, and sales analytics
Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in business administration or related field
2+ years of experience in data analysis, database administration, or a related field
Strong knowledge of the principles and practices of relational database design, management, and maintenance using SQL
Understanding of relational data modeling
Strong command of Visual Basic (VBA) and SQL
Experience using Microsoft Access to create and manage databases
Expert level of proficiency in Microsoft Office – including Microsoft Access, Excel, Word and Outlook
Experience working in an ERP system to obtain, organize and analyze data that supports sales and pricing cycles
Experience working in a CRM software is a plus
Microsoft PowerPoint presentation development is a plus
Proficient in Adobe Acrobat
Skills:
Well organized self-starter who is detail and deadline oriented with a proactive approach to all projects
Impeccable attention to detail and quality of work
Ability to work independently as well as cooperatively within a team environment
Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong communication skills and a sophisticated understanding of what should be communicated to different audiences.
Possess a work style that includes a sense of urgency, with emphasis on the importance of timeliness
A passion for data management

Solutions Through Innovative Technologies, Inc. (STI-TEC) specializes in the delivery of professional business and information management services. STI-TEC offers government and commercial clients a comprehensive portfolio of services that identify, manage, distribute and improve business processes related to entities’ most valued resource, information. As a fast-growing solutions provider, established in 2000, total customer satisfaction has remained the cornerstone of our business. Our business model focuses on integrity, loyalty, and trust.

Position Overview
Data Scientist / Analyst in support of the Air Force Readiness Division Analysis and Decision Support contract. This position provides and assists current readiness reporting data analysis and interdependencies to guide decision-making for Air Force-wide integration through the deliberate leveraging of military activities.

Essential Job Function

Observe, analyze, and translate operational readiness challenges into analytic constructs and visualizations for use in addressing long-term, recurring issues/taskings and time-critical, one-time issues/taskings (e.g., within four hours of senior leader request for analysis)
Conduct analyses and visualizations to define readiness problem statements and provide solutions that incorporate readiness data and corresponding investment decisions within the required amount of time as stated by Government lead. To the maximum extent possible use robotic process automation techniques to minimize repetitive human tasks and host serve the data in a distributed fashion within the USAF Data Fabric.
Demonstrate how analysis can improve command readiness and better meet AF and DoD-mandated reporting criteria.
Assist with the interpretations of Air Force, Joint Staff, Office of the Secretary of Defense, and Congressional questions regarding readiness and deliver actionable studies and analysis products, results, conclusions, insights, and visualizations.
Readiness reporting analysis and visualization to address Air Force, Department of Defense and Congressional leadership information, policy, and technical requirements.
Analysis and visualization to support policy and funding changes to the USAF Flying Hour Program, aviation fuels management and authorized ancillary services.
Readiness analysis and visualization to support AF/A3TR recurring and situational directed tasks to include readiness reporting queries to analyze reporting data and formulate output products for leadership.
Fully support Vice Chief of Staff Readiness Brief

Qualifications
Current Secret security clearance
Seven (7) years of combined experience that includes DoD readiness analysis and/or military service at the tactical, operational, and strategic levels; master’s degree in a field related to analysis; five (5) years of experience in data analysis; three (3) years of experience on or supporting the Air Staff or an equivalent strategic level staff and knowledge and understanding of Air Force operations. Possess Master's degree or higher in data science/data analytics or comparable subject area.
Ability to apply expert analytic and evaluative skills to determine actions necessary to support a variety of major missions and operational plans that are compatible with previous OSD decisions, AF strategy, policies, concepts and objectives, and Congressional decisions, to provide the most beneficial range of alternatives to AF leadership
Ability to extract, manipulate, distill and present a variety of readiness related inputs from multiple automated data sources into oral, written, and graphic depictions of data for use in senior level, decision quality material
Ability to perform all other analytic tasks in support of AF/A3TR and/or as directed by the senior/team lead analyst

Applicants selected may be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
STI-TEC is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. Employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, gender identity and sexual orientation.
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

DataLab USA™ is an analytics and technology driven database marketing consultancy. We combine sophisticated technology, cutting edge analytics and an intrinsic understanding of marketing to build large-scale addressable marketing programs for Fortune 500 companies. Role description
Provide support for the management of the full life cycle of marketing models: defining strategy, selecting data, cleansing data and performing data hygiene, developing models, validating performance, coding and implementing models, monitoring performance, systematically refreshing models.

Primary Responsibilities
+ Manage ETL systems, assuring data quality and monitoring database resources and activities.
+ Perform data analytics, modeling and reporting on various large data sources (GB/TB level).
+ Develop and maintaining complex data driven programs using T-SQL and related tools.
+ Interface directly with Marketing Analysts to consult on the effectiveness of marketing programs, to fulfill ad-hoc analytical requests or to supply relevant reporting material.
+ Provide support for building predictive models and analyze model effectiveness using different open-source technologies
+ Communicate analytical insights to relevant management for business strategy development.
+ Research, develop and test new modeling techniques to improve model discrimination and accuracy.
+ Make recommendations on areas to improve data, methodology or decision optimizations.
+ Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned

Requirements
+ Masters’s Degree in quantitative field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, Information Systems, or equivalent related work experience in Information Technology.
+ Working experience with SQL
+ Demonstrated technical skills in R and(or) Python
+ Strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of stakeholders
+ Excellent organizational and self-directed skills - ability to initiate, coordinate and prioritize responsibilities and follow through on tasks and projects, and ability to perform multiple tasks in an environment of frequent and often short deadlines
+ Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment as well as independently with minimal supervision
+ Self-motivated team player with strong work ethic
+ Strong understanding of Critical Analysis concepts
+ Ability to foster a cooperative work environment
+ Ability to develop, plan, and implement short- and long-range goals
+ Direct Marketing experience a plus
+ Digital Marketing experience a plus

The Prospective Group (TPG) is seeking a Business Analyst to apply their analytical and technical skills to assist in implementing business solutions.
Position Responsibilities:
Provide user stories, requirements, and business process management standard operating procedures to standardize the collection and use of user stories, requirements, and business process documentation across multiple projects. The standard operating procedures shall include industry best practices and shall include recommendations of tools to manage user stories, requirements, and business processes.
Providing requirements management and user story services, including system requirement specification (SRS), requirements traceability matrix (RTM), user stories and acceptance criteria to assure OCIO that the requirements and/or user stories of IT systems are captured and baselined to reflect the current state or proposed future state.
Document user stories, including acceptance criteria, and/or document system’s business requirements, including a statement of the organization’s business objectives; the ultimate vision of what systems will be and do; needs and expectations of the customers; and critical activities that must be performed to accomplish the objectives of the customers’ organizations.
Establish automated requirements traceability to manage requirements to report back fulfillment of customer and stakeholder interests, in terms of compliance, completeness, coverage and consistency. Traceability shall also support change management as part of requirements management in understanding the impacts of changes through requirements or other related elements (e.g., functional impacts through relations to functional architecture), and facilitating introducing these changes.
Work with OCIO and lead business unit working groups, comprised of business assigned subject matter experts (SMEs), to help end users articulate user story and acceptance criteria, desired system capabilities and functions, and as-is and to-be processes. Work with business users, project managers and systems analysts to analyze and propose changes to business processes as they relate to the implementation or retirement of automated systems.
Draft logical system and functional requirements based on working group input, existing system documentation, and other documents that are relevant to the proposed new system or system enhancements.
Assist in the identification of weak or vague requirements that may be ambiguous or cause confusion to the development process.
Write final, well-organized user stories or requirement specifications that clearly express the shared understanding of the new system or system enhancement request.
Create and present requirements in various non-textual formats including graphical analysis models, tables, presentations, storyboards, and other applicable visual aids utilizing standardized methods or industry best practices.
Facilitate coordination with project teams to collaborate and negotiate among various project stakeholders and team members to obtain and document prioritization.
Assist the government to establish roadmaps and requirements baseline to manage requirements throughout the SDLC to include utilizing and recommending industry best practices tools and policy for obtaining and managing requirements.
Produce testable test cases from functional and system requirements and user stories and ensure documented user stories and/or requirements meet customer needs by performing independent reviews and by designing test cases that map directly to documented user stories and/or requirements.
Review and test case validation shall ensure that all user stories and/or requirements are clear, correct, complete, feasible, necessary, traceable, and verifiable against specifications provided by the working groups internal documents and other requirements related data. Assist with user acceptance testing input and support.

Position Requirements:
Minimum five (5) years’ experience eliciting and documenting business and functional requirements for new and existing IT systems.
Extensive experience directly working with end users and stakeholders to document business objectives, business processes, defining, functional requirements and business rules, validating system design and testing artifacts, and assisting in testing.
Extensive experience in the creation and review of wireframes and mockups.
One (1) year experience conducting usability testing and storyboarding.

The Opportunity:
For an organization to transform in today’s digital world, it needs to properly collect, store, and organize its data. Effective data management can enable more efficient operations, yielding more growth. As a Data Analyst professional, you know how to apply your creative-thinking and analytical mindset to help organizations manage their data assets. We’re looking for an experienced data architect like you to deliver leading-edge solutions for national security and defense. As a Data Analyst on our Defense Cyber Risk Management team, you’ll use your technical expertise to design data architecture solutions for how the DoD should catalog and mitigate cyber vulnerabilities to weapon systems and defense critical infrastructure. You’ll resolve routine data architecture issues in collaboration with business analysts and technology teams by obtaining and maintaining an organizations’ data elements and identifying attributes. You will also create data storage, retrieve, troubleshoot, and implement recovery processes of the data for the purpose of visualization in a cloud environment.
In this role, you’ll apply best practices and tools, including Databricks, Qlik, Tableau, MS Power BI, Enterprise Architect, and Visio to oversee the ingestions of multiple databases and organize data elements to be utilized in providing senior leaders situational awareness of operations and capabilities. You’ll grow your technical experience as you assist in the design, definition, development, and testing of cloud solution components, serving as a liaison between clients and developers to ensure that requirements are met and solutions are delivered. With your drive to establish processes and support technological innovation, you’ll make a lasting impact on National Security.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
3+ years of experience with Data Science, including Databricks, Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik
Experience with data management, programming, big data developments, systems analysis, and technology architectures
Knowledge of industry functions, including how data is collected, analyzed, and utilized
Knowledge of modifying and building user interfaces
Ability to research new opportunities for data acquisition
Ability to communicate with government clients, contractors, and mission partners to provide shared understanding of complex data analysis to meet contractual obligations
Ability to identify and evaluate data management technologies
Ability to implement measures to ensure data accuracy and accessibility
TS/SCI clearance
Bachelor's degree
Nice If You Have:
Experience in Cybersecurity or Cybersecurity certifications
Experience working with OSD, Headquarters level organizations in the DoD
Experience in AI and ML such as Natural Language Processing (NLP) or other advanced capabilities
Ability to program in Python, Java, and R
Possession of excellent analytical problem-solving skills, including employing the right approach and methods to maximize use of time and human resources
Certified Data Management Professional
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

This role will have the central responsibility to manage all master data, SAP, and OEC Fusion to ensure data entered correctly and conforms to SK standards for system functionality.

Manage all SAP master data that impacts plants, co-packers, customer, pricing and materials.

Knowledge of changing industry standards. Keep team apprised of any changes on a regular basis.

We are looking for people who are driven by a sense of purpose. In this role, you will serve as a Data Labelling Analyst and help to solve and answer our customers' most complex and unique intelligence questions and problems.

Washington, DC or Palo Alto, CA

As a Data Labelling Analyst, you will support our data labelling efforts to help support our modelling efforts. Data Labelling Analyst will work as part of a collaborative team and will work in tandem to deliver a specific set of labelled objects per image.

Label objects in imagery as required, and meet/exceed data labelling objectives to support a fast-moving, dynamic, organization.
Regularly communicate with project leadership and provide updates about labeling, frame extraction, and data workflows.
Support the Identification of the needs of the data team and develop and implement appropriate labelling responses.
Maintain the privacy and confidentiality of all information and data.

First and second-year undergraduates with interest in political science, artificial intelligence, regional studies, and international affairs are strongly encouraged to apply for internship opportunities.
Prior experience with imagery analysis and labelling is preferred, but not required.
Prior experience in Chinese naval battle of order is a plus.
We're looking for candidates with proven analytical skills, are excited to solve problems, and have excellent interpersonal and collaborative skills. Including but not limited to positive attitude, a learning mentality, creative, and solution oriented.

Rhombus Power Inc. (Rhombus) is a NASA Research Park startup located in the heart of Silicon Valley. We use cutting-edge cross-disciplinary approaches to solve pressing Big Data and Sensing problems in security, energy, and healthcare. Our advisory board includes two Nobel Laureates and a Draper Prize winner.

The Data Analyst will support the Data & Analytics Team in performing data analysis, generating reports, and contributing to the development of cloud/hybrid data solutions for internal and external clients. Job Title: Data Transformation Analyst II/Customer Support Associate
Description:
Job Description:
Your role
Are you an analytical thinker with a high level of attention to detail? Do you enjoy problem solving, data research, and helping customers with complex business solutions?
We’re looking for a Data Transformation Analyst/Customer Support Associate within the OPIS Retail Fuels Division. In this hybrid role, you will:
Maintain the data quality for retail fuels pricing, station, and amenities data across North America and Australia, eventually expanding globally.
Run quality control processes to correct or eliminate incorrect or invalid data points according to OPIS methodology.
Assist the retail business development and product development teams in data reliability goals.
Provide sales support by creating historical data files, setting prospective clients up on trials of our services, and answering questions regarding data methodology and data quality.
Continue the OPIS legacy of providing the highest-quality customer support in the industry.
Your team
We’re OPIS, a Dow Jones company. In this role, you will be joining the OPIS Retail Data Quality Team primarily located in the United States, with remote workers globally. This team of 10 direct colleagues and many secondary colleagues is part of a high-growth division that manages the quality of retail fuel pricing and station data. OPIS Retail team members work with fuel retailers and convenience store operators to provide data and analytics that help them optimize their business operations and run more profitably and efficiently.
You’ll also work with other industries that utilize OPIS data, such as connected cars and mobile app/web clients who display OPIS real-time retail fuel prices and station information directly to consumers. And in a world where the reliance on fossil fuels is slowly diminishing as we look for cleaner and more sustainable energy options, OPIS is diversifying and future-proofing our business by expanding into clean energy, alternative fuels, and data and analytics for electric vehicles, while still providing world class data and products for the energy that moves us today.
Your expertise
You have
A bachelor’s degree. Business, Data Analytics, and Mathematics degrees are a strong fit for this role.
Prior experience with data management and/or customer service.
Fluency in English, both written and oral, with other language skills desirable based on our global customer base.
Knowledge in data visualization/analytics tools such as Power BI or Tableu and a fluency in all MS Office applications, with advanced Excel expertise a priority. Proficiency in SQL Server Management Studio, R, or Python is a plus, but not required.
You are
Organized with strong problem-solving skills, including the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
A self-motivated individual who is able to work effectively and collaboratively with all co-workers, while also completing projects independently.
Strong with data analytics, able to transform and analyze data to find insights and to create solutions that help automate improvements in our data quality.
Driven by the desire to help others succeed, delivering the highest levels of customer service and professionalism.
Working Hours
9:30am – 6:30pm Eastern Time (UTC -5)

Solutions Through Innovative Technologies, Inc. (STI-TEC) specializes in the delivery of professional business and information management services. STI-TEC offers government and commercial clients a comprehensive portfolio of services that identify, manage, distribute and improve business processes related to entities’ most valued resource, information. As a fast-growing solutions provider, established in 2000, total customer satisfaction has remained the cornerstone of our business. Our business model focuses on integrity, loyalty, and trust.

Position Overview
Data Scientist / Analyst in support of the Air Force Readiness Division Analysis and Decision Support contract. This position provides and assists current readiness reporting data analysis and interdependencies to guide decision-making for Air Force-wide integration through the deliberate leveraging of military activities.

Essential Job Function

Observe, analyze, and translate operational readiness challenges into analytic constructs and visualizations for use in addressing long-term, recurring issues/taskings and time-critical, one-time issues/taskings (e.g., within four hours of senior leader request for analysis)
Conduct analyses and visualizations to define readiness problem statements and provide solutions that incorporate readiness data and corresponding investment decisions within the required amount of time as stated by Government lead. To the maximum extent possible use robotic process automation techniques to minimize repetitive human tasks and host serve the data in a distributed fashion within the USAF Data Fabric.
Demonstrate how analysis can improve command readiness and better meet AF and DoD-mandated reporting criteria.
Assist with the interpretations of Air Force, Joint Staff, Office of the Secretary of Defense, and Congressional questions regarding readiness and deliver actionable studies and analysis products, results, conclusions, insights, and visualizations.
Readiness reporting analysis and visualization to address Air Force, Department of Defense and Congressional leadership information, policy, and technical requirements.
Analysis and visualization to support policy and funding changes to the USAF Flying Hour Program, aviation fuels management and authorized ancillary services.
Readiness analysis and visualization to support AF/A3TR recurring and situational directed tasks to include readiness reporting queries to analyze reporting data and formulate output products for leadership.
Fully support Vice Chief of Staff Readiness Brief

Qualifications
Current Secret security clearance
Seven (7) years of combined experience that includes DoD readiness analysis and/or military service at the tactical, operational, and strategic levels; master’s degree in a field related to analysis; five (5) years of experience in data analysis; three (3) years of experience on or supporting the Air Staff or an equivalent strategic level staff and knowledge and understanding of Air Force operations. Possess Master's degree or higher in data science/data analytics or comparable subject area.
Ability to apply expert analytic and evaluative skills to determine actions necessary to support a variety of major missions and operational plans that are compatible with previous OSD decisions, AF strategy, policies, concepts and objectives, and Congressional decisions, to provide the most beneficial range of alternatives to AF leadership
Ability to extract, manipulate, distill and present a variety of readiness related inputs from multiple automated data sources into oral, written, and graphic depictions of data for use in senior level, decision quality material
Ability to perform all other analytic tasks in support of AF/A3TR and/or as directed by the senior/team lead analyst

Applicants selected may be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

Position Responsibilities:
Provide user stories, requirements, and business process management standard operating procedures to standardize the collection and use of user stories, requirements, and business process documentation across multiple projects. The standard operating procedures shall include industry best practices and shall include recommendations of tools to manage user stories, requirements, and business processes.
Providing requirements management and user story services, including system requirement specification (SRS), requirements traceability matrix (RTM), user stories and acceptance criteria to assure OCIO that the requirements and/or user stories of IT systems are captured and baselined to reflect the current state or proposed future state.
Document user stories, including acceptance criteria, and/or document system’s business requirements, including a statement of the organization’s business objectives; the ultimate vision of what systems will be and do; needs and expectations of the customers; and critical activities that must be performed to accomplish the objectives of the customers’ organizations.
Establish automated requirements traceability to manage requirements to report back fulfillment of customer and stakeholder interests, in terms of compliance, completeness, coverage and consistency. Traceability shall also support change management as part of requirements management in understanding the impacts of changes through requirements or other related elements (e.g., functional impacts through relations to functional architecture), and facilitating introducing these changes.
Work with OCIO and lead business unit working groups, comprised of business assigned subject matter experts (SMEs), to help end users articulate user story and acceptance criteria, desired system capabilities and functions, and as-is and to-be processes. Work with business users, project managers and systems analysts to analyze and propose changes to business processes as they relate to the implementation or retirement of automated systems.
Draft logical system and functional requirements based on working group input, existing system documentation, and other documents that are relevant to the proposed new system or system enhancements.
Assist in the identification of weak or vague requirements that may be ambiguous or cause confusion to the development process.
Write final, well-organized user stories or requirement specifications that clearly express the shared understanding of the new system or system enhancement request.
Create and present requirements in various non-textual formats including graphical analysis models, tables, presentations, storyboards, and other applicable visual aids utilizing standardized methods or industry best practices.
Facilitate coordination with project teams to collaborate and negotiate among various project stakeholders and team members to obtain and document prioritization.
Assist the government to establish roadmaps and requirements baseline to manage requirements throughout the SDLC to include utilizing and recommending industry best practices tools and policy for obtaining and managing requirements.
Produce testable test cases from functional and system requirements and user stories and ensure documented user stories and/or requirements meet customer needs by performing independent reviews and by designing test cases that map directly to documented user stories and/or requirements.
Review and test case validation shall ensure that all user stories and/or requirements are clear, correct, complete, feasible, necessary, traceable, and verifiable against specifications provided by the working groups internal documents and other requirements related data. Assist with user acceptance testing input and support.

Position Requirements:
Minimum five (5) years’ experience eliciting and documenting business and functional requirements for new and existing IT systems.
Extensive experience directly working with end users and stakeholders to document business objectives, business processes, defining, functional requirements and business rules, validating system design and testing artifacts, and assisting in testing.
Extensive experience in the creation and review of wireframes and mockups.
One (1) year experience conducting usability testing and storyboarding.

The Opportunity:
For an organization to transform in today’s digital world, it needs to properly collect, store, and organize its data. Effective data management can enable more efficient operations, yielding more growth. As a Data Analyst professional, you know how to apply your creative-thinking and analytical mindset to help organizations manage their data assets. We’re looking for an experienced data architect like you to deliver leading-edge solutions for national security and defense. As a Data Analyst on our Defense Cyber Risk Management team, you’ll use your technical expertise to design data architecture solutions for how the DoD should catalog and mitigate cyber vulnerabilities to weapon systems and defense critical infrastructure. You’ll resolve routine data architecture issues in collaboration with business analysts and technology teams by obtaining and maintaining an organizations’ data elements and identifying attributes. You will also create data storage, retrieve, troubleshoot, and implement recovery processes of the data for the purpose of visualization in a cloud environment.
In this role, you’ll apply best practices and tools, including Databricks, Qlik, Tableau, MS Power BI, Enterprise Architect, and Visio to oversee the ingestions of multiple databases and organize data elements to be utilized in providing senior leaders situational awareness of operations and capabilities. You’ll grow your technical experience as you assist in the design, definition, development, and testing of cloud solution components, serving as a liaison between clients and developers to ensure that requirements are met and solutions are delivered. With your drive to establish processes and support technological innovation, you’ll make a lasting impact on National Security.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
3+ years of experience with Data Science, including Databricks, Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik
Experience with data management, programming, big data developments, systems analysis, and technology architectures
Knowledge of industry functions, including how data is collected, analyzed, and utilized
Knowledge of modifying and building user interfaces
Ability to research new opportunities for data acquisition
Ability to communicate with government clients, contractors, and mission partners to provide shared understanding of complex data analysis to meet contractual obligations
Ability to identify and evaluate data management technologies
Ability to implement measures to ensure data accuracy and accessibility
TS/SCI clearance
Bachelor's degree
Nice If You Have:
Experience in Cybersecurity or Cybersecurity certifications
Experience working with OSD, Headquarters level organizations in the DoD
Experience in AI and ML such as Natural Language Processing (NLP) or other advanced capabilities
Ability to program in Python, Java, and R
Possession of excellent analytical problem-solving skills, including employing the right approach and methods to maximize use of time and human resources
Certified Data Management Professional
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.
