Job Title: Data Analysis and Visualization Specialist, Junior
Description:
Quadrint is a fast-growing, Information Technology consulting company in the public sector that has been named to The Washington Post's Top Workplaces for five consecutive years! We pride ourselves in our employees feeling welcomed, valued, and involved.

Full vaccination against COVID-19, and compliance with Quadrint’s vaccination verification procedures, is required for this position, unless the individual is legally entitled to a reasonable accommodation.

Quadrint is seeking a Data Analysis and Visualization Specialist, Junior in the Springfield, VA area.

A Data Analysis and Visualization Specialist, Junior will collect, analyze, visualize, and report data across multiple NGA and NGC designated platforms and tools (e.g., PeopleSoft, HRIS, Blackboard, Tableau, etc.) to convey metrics and information on NGC outcomes and program performance that leads to recommendations for business decisions and development of organizational strategies.

A qualified candidate will perform the following duties and responsibilities, but are not limited to:
Develop a Data Management Strategy and provides recommendations for how stakeholders might adjust their data collection and storage processes and procedures to best fit the strategy.
Develop and maintain a list of all data, including data sources, standards, structure, and system of origin.
Document requirements for how the data moves between systems and aggregates in a centralized system or repository for reporting.
Conduct audits as necessary to uncover any data integrity issues. Data includes but is not limited to: HRIS/LMS data, performance management data, instructor performance data, and learning requirements data.
Process and analyze various sources of NGC data in Excel and Tableau and develop/maintain data visualizations, reports, briefings, dashboards, discussion points, and other products for the Government.
Collaborate with various stakeholders to determine the customer requirement for data products and work with the Government to determine the best approach to development.
Develop customer-facing dashboards in support of NGC and Agency training data reporting and training operations.
Maintain all NGC dashboards, to include regular meetings with stakeholders to ensure dashboards are meeting their needs.
Develop and run queries, reports, and scripts using HRIS/LMS data.
Collaborate on any data adjustments required in support of live dashboards.
Security Clearance Requirement:
Active/current TS/SCI and the ability to obtain/maintain a Polygraph clearance is required.

Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Information Systems, Education, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field from an accredited (i.e., regional, national, or institutional) academic institution.
At least 2+ years of experience providing expertise in data collection, analysis, and reporting performance.
Proficiency in Kirkpatrick evaluation model, survey design, and statistical software packages (SPSS, Tableau) to develop and execute comprehensive performance measurement.
Ability to analyze assessment data and conduct descriptive and inferential analysis to develop detailed reports, delivered through documents, dashboards, and raw data sets to inform stakeholders of course effectiveness.
Strong proficiency to manage and manipulate date in Excel and Tableau and develop/maintain data visualizations, reports, briefings, dashboards, and discussion points that convey information useful for decision making by various stakeholder groups.
Ability to work across organizational teams to develop and run queries, reports, and scripts using available data to justify recommendations and inform decision making by leadership.

Description
Do you want to build a career that is truly worthwhile? Working at the World Bank Group provides a unique opportunity for you to help our clients solve their greatest development challenges. The World Bank Group is one of the largest sources of funding and knowledge for developing countries; a unique global partnership of five institutions dedicated to ending extreme poverty, increasing shared prosperity and promoting sustainable development. With 189 member countries and more than 120 offices worldwide, we work with public and private sector partners, investing in groundbreaking projects and using data, research, and technology to develop solutions to the most urgent global challenges. For more information, visit www.worldbank.org

The 25 Executive Directors of the World Bank Group (WBG Board), assisted by their Alternates, Senior Advisors, Advisors, and Administrative staff, represent the interests of the 189-member countries who nominated or elected them. They also ensure the oversight of the general operations of the Bank Group and the group’s results on the ground. The institutions under their purview are: The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD), the International Development Association (IDA), which together form the World Bank; the International Finance Corporation (IFC); the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA); and the International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes (ICSID). The World Bank Group is one of the world's largest sources of funding and knowledge for developing countries. The Board, working closely with Management, approves policies, financial commitments, and knowledge products that ensure the best global expertise and help generate cutting-edge results for its clients in developing countries.

The WBG Board of Executive Directors considers and decides on the proposals made by the President of the WBG as they relate to IBRD loans and guarantees, IDA credits and grants, IFC investments, and MIGA guarantees; and endorse the strategies and policies that impact the World Bank's general operations. Executive Directors are also responsible for conveying the interests and concerns of their Constituency members to the Board and the Bank’s management, as well as the interests and concerns of the Bank to their Constituency.

The Office of the Executive Director (ED) for Benin, Burkina Faso, Cabo Verde, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Congo (Democratic Republic of), Congo (Republic of), Cote d'Ivoire, Djibouti, Equatorial Guinea, Gabon, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Madagascar, Mali, Mauritania, Mauritius, Niger, Sao Tome and Principe, Senegal, Togo constituency (EDS13) is looking for a Research Analyst to assist the Office of the Executive Director in analytical duties. Please see below for further details.

In addition to the Executive Director, the office consists of an Alternate Executive Director, Senior Advisors, Advisors, and four other administrative support staff.

The successful candidate will report to the Executive Director and work in Washington, DC.

Note:
This position is for a 2-year Term. Any staff on an open-ended appointment who is selected is strongly advised to obtain a re-entry guarantee from his/her releasing unit to enable return to open-ended status. An open-ended staff who does not have a re-entry to his/her releasing unit acknowledges that by applying to this position, s/he is entering a Term position if selected and will not be able to maintain his/her open-ended status in the ED office.

The staff will be subject to a performance review per the WBG annual performance review processes.

Roles & Responsibility:

The main responsibilities of the successful candidate will be to collect and analyze data to allow constituency countries to fully contribute to the elaboration of strategies and programs financed and sponsored by the World Bank Group.
The Analyst will assist the Executive Director in managing interactions across the WBG’s entities, the Regional and Sectoral VPUs, and other EDs, as well as with constituency members and external partners, to identify relevant sources of information that allow the performance of relevant, data-driven analysis and ensures countries to proactively contribute to the elaboration of projects and programs. The work includes but is not limited to research on the economic situation of various countries, update of economic and development indicators, and maintenance of the dashboards to assist the ED in deploying his/her strategic plan to increase financing and advisory services and exploit the MFD (Maximizing Finance for Development) approach to benefit the economies of the countries in the ED’s constituency.

Working with the Executive Director, Alternate Executive Director (AED), Senior Advisors, Advisors, and Assistants on a range of tasks, including:
Identify, gather, and analyze data to produce high-quality reports and other outputs that meet the needs of the Office.

Coordinate the preparation of periodic analyses and information reports for constituency authorities and management as assigned by the ED or AED.

Support the Office in maintaining the official website and conducting the research to support Office activities and presentations.

Participate in meetings and events, and prepare materials as assigned by the ED or AED.

Assist in preparing briefing materials, presentations, and talking points for the ED in his interactions with the countries, the Executive Board, and various partners.

Provide high-quality support to the Executive Director/Alternate Executive Director and Senior Advisors/Advisors in a multicultural environment.

Liaise with appropriate contacts in the capitals of the constituency to gather and manage information, indicators and development strategies to build and regularly update a dashboard for each country to help implement the office strategy.

Handle ad hoc duties assigned by the ED and AED.

Selection Criteria
Must have a Master’s degree (e.g., in Economics, Finance, Banking, Business Administration, or related discipline) and a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience.
Experience working in or on issues related to the Western and Central Africa Region.
Ability to conduct research, analyze, and propose solutions to support strategic goals.
Knowledge and understanding of the functions and operations of the WBG.
Highly skilled in information technology and digital platforms. Skills in graphic design are an added advantage.
Strong written and oral communication skills with the ability to summarize issues into oral and written briefs in English and French.
Must have attention to detail and follow-through.
Strong team player with the ability to work independently and in a diverse team.
Ability to work effectively in a multicultural environment and strong interpersonal skills. Proficiency in French is required.
Ability to independently manage multiple assignments with minimal supervision, prioritizing and coordinating team members under tight deadlines.
Willingness to accept personal ownership and accountability for meeting deadlines and achieving results.
Awareness of relevant internal and external factors and their impact on the constituency countries.
Willingness to work long hours and availability to travel when needed.
Required Competencies
Technology and systems knowledge - Has advanced proficiency in the latest technology relevant to assigned responsibilities. Demonstrates initiative in learning and supporting the implementation of emerging technology and systems pertinent to the effective work of the unit.
Project and task management - Able to organize, coordinate, monitor, and implement tasks and projects. Demonstrates ownership and accountability for results. Demonstrates innovation and creativity in promoting effectiveness.
Institutional policies, processes, and procedures - Demonstrates in-depth, and up-to-date knowledge of administrative and policy guidelines, practices, products, and services in the area of assigned functional responsibility; can guide others in complex situations.
Versatility and adaptability - Able to anticipate, facilitate and catalyze change in the business environment and accurately assess the need for new skills and knowledge. Demonstrates continued learning attitude, supporting others in their learning and change management efforts.
World Bank Group Core Competencies

Description:
Overview:
Join the HJF Team!

The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine (HJF) is a nonprofit organization dedicated to advancing military medicine. We serve military, medical, academic and government clients by administering, managing and supporting preeminent scientific programs that benefit members of the armed forces and civilians alike. Since its founding in 1983, HJF has served as a vital link between the military medical community and its federal and private partners. HJF's support and administrative capabilities allow military medical researchers and clinicians to maintain their scientific focus and accomplish their research goals.

HJF is seeking a Data Analyst I or II to provide analytic support The Military Health System Response to COVID-19 (MiHReC19) project through the Center for Health Services Research (CHSR) located at the Rockledge Office in Bethesda, MD. The Data Analyst will provide analytic support to epidemiologists, biostatisticians and scientists and ensure data quality and data integrity.

The Military Health System Response to COVID-19 (MiHReC19) project will investigate the long-term effects of COVID-19 on the Military Health System (MHS). The project will use a comprehensive Health Systems approach in order to maximize the translatable, actionable knowledge generated from the lessons learned. The Postdoctoral Fellow will be responsible for initiating and carrying out research projects in collaboration with the Military Health System Response to COVID-19 research team. They will pursue health services and health system research along a focused line of inquiry and produce manuscripts and other knowledge translation products.

US Citizenship Required. Remote option available.
Responsibilities:
Imports, cleans, transforms, validates and/or model data with the purpose of understanding or making conclusions from the data for decision making and public health purposes.
Assists in making data accessible to epidemiologists, scientists, physicians, programmers and other end users.
Tests data to identify data integrity issues, making recommendations and coordinating with the data manager to plan solutions.
Troubleshoots problems concerning database records and communicate with co-workers and end users of the system. Makes recommendations and coordinates with the data manager to plan solutions.
Recommends operating methods to improve processing, distribution, data flow, collection and database editing procedures.
Participates in data-related projects, including but not limited to data normalization, data maintenance, data research, data standardization, data product development, and data quality assurance.
May perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned or directed by the supervisor. This may include attendance of and participation in required training for role.

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Must have strong SAS, Excel and MS SQL skills.
General knowledge of SPSS, R, and/or STATA software.
Knowledge and application of data cleansing and migration techniques.
Demonstrated analytical skills and passion for analyzing data.
Experience with data modelling.
Ability to investigate data issues and participate in remediation activities.
Statistical and data analysis skills are a must to assist gathering and solving data quality issues.
Ability to review detailed documents to validate data in operating systems.
Experience in writing requirements.
Excel MACROS experience is a plus.
Familiarity with IDC9 and IDClO coding.
Must provide two writing samples.

Supervisory Responsibilities
Assigned Lead: May recommend the following: employee hiring, provide input on employee performance evaluations.
Qualifications:
Work Environment
Set in an Office or Clinic environment

Bachelor's Degree Required; Master’s Degree Preferred
Minimum of 3-5 years experience required

DataLab USA™ is an analytics and technology driven database marketing consultancy. We combine sophisticated technology, cutting edge analytics and an intrinsic understanding of marketing to build large-scale addressable marketing programs for Fortune 500 companies. Our clients operate in multiple verticals: Financial Services, Insurance, Telcom, and Travel & Leisure.

We have placed in the INC 5000 list of fastest growing private companies for six times in the last ten years. At its heart, DataLab USA™ has the entrepreneurial spirit of a start-up. We judge ourselves on our ability to innovate, drive efficiency and deliver excellence for our clients.

Role description
Provide support for the management of the full life cycle of marketing models: defining strategy, selecting data, cleansing data and performing data hygiene, developing models, validating performance, coding and implementing models, monitoring performance, systematically refreshing models.

Primary Responsibilities
+ Manage ETL systems, assuring data quality and monitoring database resources and activities.
+ Perform data analytics, modeling and reporting on various large data sources (GB/TB level).
+ Develop and maintaining complex data driven programs using T-SQL and related tools.
+ Interface directly with Marketing Analysts to consult on the effectiveness of marketing programs, to fulfill ad-hoc analytical requests or to supply relevant reporting material.
+ Provide support for building predictive models and analyze model effectiveness using different open-source technologies
+ Communicate analytical insights to relevant management for business strategy development.
+ Research, develop and test new modeling techniques to improve model discrimination and accuracy.
+ Make recommendations on areas to improve data, methodology or decision optimizations.
+ Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned

Requirements
+ Masters’s Degree in quantitative field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, Information Systems, or equivalent related work experience in Information Technology.
+ Working experience with SQL
+ Demonstrated technical skills in R and(or) Python
+ Strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of stakeholders
+ Excellent organizational and self-directed skills - ability to initiate, coordinate and prioritize responsibilities and follow through on tasks and projects, and ability to perform multiple tasks in an environment of frequent and often short deadlines
+ Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment as well as independently with minimal supervision
+ Self-motivated team player with strong work ethic
+ Strong understanding of Critical Analysis concepts
+ Ability to foster a cooperative work environment
+ Ability to develop, plan, and implement short- and long-range goals
+ Direct Marketing experience a plus
+ Digital Marketing experience a plus

**NO Sponsorship offered for this position**
DataLab USA™ is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.
All offers of employment are contingent on passing a background check and drug test.

Are you a data whiz who wants to make an impact? Do you excel at making sense out of numerical chaos? Montage Marketing Group wants you.
Montage is looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing team. Qualified candidates will have the knowledge, experience and attitude needed to effectively decipher data and detect trends across programs. The role supports various programmatic teams within Montage Marketing Group.
This is a full-time, exempt position working a hybrid schedule of home office and at Montage's McLean, VA office. Annual salary for this position is $65,000 - $75,000.
About the Role
The Data Analyst will support the Data & Analytics Team in performing data analysis, generating reports, and contributing to the development of cloud/hybrid data solutions for internal and external clients. The ideal candidate can identify operational incongruities and recommend/implement the best remediation.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Intelligence, Computer Science, Marketing Analytics, or related fields
5-7 years of experience creating complex queries with Python; SQL experience a plus
Familiarity with statistical software including SPSS or R
Proficiency with data modeling and visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau; Zoho Analytics experience a plus
Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel (syntax, pivot tables, power query, etc.)
Experience with cloud-based data technologies
Knowledge of various ETL techniques
Strong organizational, communication, and critical-thinking skills
Ability to collaborate and work as part of a team
Must have prior authorization to work in the U.S.
Serve as a subject matter expert for projects and initiatives that require data aggregation, analysis, and integration
Work with the data team to build and maintain database environments
Responsibilities
The core responsibility of the Data Analyst is to analyze and aggregate disparate data points for the development of reports, presentations, and dashboards for both internal and external clients. The Data Analyst will help to automate the aggregation process, to include the development of new tools and resources. The ideal candidate must be a team player, have a keen eye for detail, and bring a visionary attitude.
Additional Responsibilities Include:
Collaborate in new asset development to ensure mechanisms are in place for data capture; provide input and recommendations for changes to processes, tools, methods, and training to enable achievement of the program goals
Perform ETL operations of data securely and within data governance standards
Track company time accurately using the company's internal time tracking system.

Colvin Run Networks seeks a Senior Data Analyst with a strong background in framing and conducting empirical and qualitative assessments of large enterprises to include data visualization, formulating data collection schemas from diverse sources, evaluating, and improving data quality, analyzing data using traditional statistical, advanced Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning techniques; modeling operational systems, and communicating results to C-level managers and leaders.
In addition to analyst experience, the candidate have past experience working on Navy maintenance metrics and analytics.
The Data Analyst will work alongside government personnel in the Metrics Directorate of NAVSEA, SEA 21 providing primarily consulting, facilitating, and performing metric development, dashboard framework development, data management schemas, analysis, and recommending areas for productivity improvement. The Data Analyst will routinely produce statistical analysis products and strategic plans for data management and functional improvement.
This position is seated in the Washington Navy Yard with potential opportunity for limited teleworking. Minimal travel is expected.
In this role, you will:
Review and advise on current data analytics projects within the Navy Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA).

Research and advise Senior Leadership on industry and academic advances in Data Science and Advanced Analytics.
Develop data visualization analysis and reports using Tableau.
Develop and code SQL queries and analytic algorithms that evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources for data/text mining, analysis, modeling, and prediction toward enabling informed business decisions.
Develop working relationships with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging corporate data to drive business solutions.

Devise and implement new ways to improve data and search quality, and predictive capabilities.
Apply expertise in data interpretation and synthesis, which requires both tools and methods from statistics and machine learning.
Coordinate with different functional teams to ensure modeling and analysis are aligned with business processes and objectives.

An Active DoD Issued Secret Clearance at the time of application.
Bachelor’s Degree in an applied mathematical discipline such as physics, engineering, computer science, or similar, and 5 to 7 years of relevant experience is required.
Experience supporting senior leaders and collaborating across large enterprises.
Excellent communication (i.e., oral, writing, presentation) skills for briefing Flag/SES leaders; specifically, presentation skills.
Experience using at least one statistical analytic package (Minitab, SPSS, etc.) and SQL
Experience with data visualization using Tableau.

NAVSEA or Navy experience.
Experience with Depot-level Overhaul, Maintenance, and Modernization activities.
Advanced competency with Microsoft Office suite of tools (i.e., Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.) in a DOD setting, Navy preferred.
Produces written deliverables to include reports, spreadsheets, databases, formal process mapping, technical design, system testing, and implementation activities explaining their findings and recommendations for managers, executives, and other officials.
Algorithm writing experience with Python and similar AI / ML languages is desired.

The Opportunity:
For an organization to transform in today’s digital world, it needs to properly collect, store, and organize its data. Effective data management can enable more efficient operations, yielding more growth. As a Data Analyst professional, you know how to apply your creative-thinking and analytical mindset to help organizations manage their data assets. We’re looking for an experienced data architect like you to deliver leading-edge solutions for national security and defense. As a Data Analyst on our Defense Cyber Risk Management team, you’ll use your technical expertise to design data architecture solutions for how the DoD should catalog and mitigate cyber vulnerabilities to weapon systems and defense critical infrastructure. You’ll resolve routine data architecture issues in collaboration with business analysts and technology teams by obtaining and maintaining an organizations’ data elements and identifying attributes. You will also create data storage, retrieve, troubleshoot, and implement recovery processes of the data for the purpose of visualization in a cloud environment.
In this role, you’ll apply best practices and tools, including Databricks, Qlik, Tableau, MS Power BI, Enterprise Architect, and Visio to oversee the ingestions of multiple databases and organize data elements to be utilized in providing senior leaders situational awareness of operations and capabilities. You’ll grow your technical experience as you assist in the design, definition, development, and testing of cloud solution components, serving as a liaison between clients and developers to ensure that requirements are met and solutions are delivered. With your drive to establish processes and support technological innovation, you’ll make a lasting impact on National Security.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
3+ years of experience with Data Science, including Databricks, Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik
Experience with data management, programming, big data developments, systems analysis, and technology architectures
Knowledge of industry functions, including how data is collected, analyzed, and utilized
Knowledge of modifying and building user interfaces
Ability to research new opportunities for data acquisition
Ability to communicate with government clients, contractors, and mission partners to provide shared understanding of complex data analysis to meet contractual obligations
Ability to identify and evaluate data management technologies
Ability to implement measures to ensure data accuracy and accessibility
TS/SCI clearance
Bachelor's degree
Nice If You Have:
Experience in Cybersecurity or Cybersecurity certifications
Experience working with OSD, Headquarters level organizations in the DoD
Experience in AI and ML such as Natural Language Processing (NLP) or other advanced capabilities
Ability to program in Python, Java, and R
Possession of excellent analytical problem-solving skills, including employing the right approach and methods to maximize use of time and human resources
Certified Data Management Professional

Overview:
HORUS Technology Solutions is looking for a Business Analyst to join our team.

The Business Analyst’s role is to analyze and design solutions to business problems while facilitating the development of multiple solution options to address the needs of the customer. Outputs will include system documentation, web content, and word documents to be read by both technical and non-technical personnel across all stakeholders, gathering requirements, creating specifications and preparing other system documentation.

A top candidate would be very client focused. To be a strong team player you must be proactive in identifying issues and risks, and work with the client and the team to be a trusted advisor. Another challenge is maintaining an excellent level of current operational support while planning and integrating new enhancements and technologies.
Responsibilities:
Perform and contribute to eliciting, analyzing and documenting requirements in support of system, business, stakeholder, and user requirements.
Translate business process needs into technical requirements.
Create and maintain product roadmap
Develop work and process flows to represent user actions, system processes and data integrations.
Support development of user stories, mock-ups/wireframes, use cases, system requirements specification documents, user guides, and other supporting functional documents to support reviews and software release deliveries.
Identify acceptance criteria and assisting in testing as needed.
Support operations by creating, testing, and coordinating the production execution of data corrections using SQL queries.
Collaborate with software developers and testers to ensure that system design, development, and test specifications satisfy approved requirements.
Work with program stakeholders to ensure continuous process improvement and apply Agile Scrum best practices and methods across the engineering life cycle.
Create and maintain product backlog in JIRA

Description
Are you looking for interesting and meaningful ways to apply your knowledge and talents? Our corporate vision at Leidos is to be the global leader in the development and application of technology to solve our customers' most demanding challenges. And that's where you come in. We need a results-oriented Data Analyst to support the NC3 Enterprise Center's (NEC) Systems Engineering and Integration (SE&I) Division at Fort Meade, MD.
This isn't just any job. The SE&I Division serves as the hub for systems engineering and enterprise architecture, and as the technical authority for the Nuclear Command, Control, and Communications (NC3) Enterprise within the Department of Defense. Our customer, led by the Commander, U.S. Strategic Command (USSTRATCOM), applies subject matter expertise and best practices to translate mission and operational requirements into solutions and operational capabilities.
This is your chance to be a part of something truly significant. Working in support of our customer at Fort Meade, you'll have the opportunity to use your skills to help tackle some of the biggest challenges faced by our nation's leaders. So what are you waiting for? Join our team and become part of the solution, apply today!
Clearance: You must currently hold an active DoD Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility to qualify for this role.
What will you do in this role?
Respond to queries from NEC SE&I for data that may be stored across multiple documents, databases, networks, and software environments. Responsible for collecting, cleaning, and presenting the data in the required format.
Support NEC SE&I’s digital modeling and model-based systems engineering efforts. Extract relevant data from text documents (e.g., Microsoft Word and Adobe PDF) and other sources (e.g., Microsoft Visio) and converting it to a format (e.g., Excel, CSV, or SysML) for importing into a digital modeling environment.
Collaborate with NC3 architecture teams to provide input to capture user requirements and use cases for improvement of the NC3 Digital Mission Engineering Environment (NDMEE). Coordinate with enterprise Data Governance Group (DGG) to develop the NC3 enterprise data standards and processes for architectural products in the NDMEE.
Recommend new initiatives; coordinate with other technical specialists in government, academia, and industry to keep abreast of emerging technologies, which relate to developing the Nuclear C3 Architecture.
Provide support to SE&I leadership and offer technical analysis, findings, and recommendations as related to Nuclear C3 Systems and Architecture.

What are the required qualifications?
Active Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility.
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a relevant technical discipline and at least 3 years of prior relevant experience.
Experience conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design; developing analysis and reporting capabilities; monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
Experience using statistical methods to analyze data and generate reports; create models to depict trends in the customer base and identify specific data needs for analysis projects.
Knowledge of data visualization principles, data visualization tools, and database management tools and principles.
What are the program preferred qualifications?
Experience working with senior Nuclear C3 community stakeholders such as NEC, USSTRATCOM, the Joint Staff, and OSD.
Knowledge of digital modeling tools (e.g., SparxEA, Cameo).
Knowledge of the Anaconda data analysis environment, natural language processing tools and procedures, and relevant Python tools and models.
Knowledge of Python-based data visualization tools (e.g., Dash, Matplotlib, Seaborn).

Data Analyst, Midlevel
Location: Fairfax, VA or Aurora, CO site options (relocation assistance is available)
Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Active Top Secret/SCI
Program Overview:
The NASK Small Satellite (SmallSAT) Program includes new satellite development and operations of on-orbit one-of-a-kind research and development satellites, software engineering support, mission planning, and anomaly resolution. You will enjoy working with research and development spacecraft. We focus on mission, with collaboration, sustainability, and innovation serving as the foundation upon which our employees work and thrive. Our efforts are enabling scientific and technical intelligence production for the United States Air Force, the Department of Defense and national level intelligence efforts.
Data Analyst Role:
Are you self-motivated? Do you find yourself constantly looking for more and better information? Do you want a job that relies on your intuitiveness and drive? A broader range of connected devices, faster connections, and a dynamic world-wide environment have resulted in an explosion of problems facing the intelligence community and it’s understanding of how to turn data into answers. That’s where you come in. If you have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset, we have an opportunity for you to use those skills to protect our national security.
As a data analyst on our team, you’ll explore new data sources, create effective queries, and combine information from multiple sources to help our intelligence partners understand their mission environment. This is a chance to grow your expertise, develop new skills, and be part of a small company in a dynamic work atmosphere. We focus on delivering the best support to our customers, so you’ll have many opportunities to wear multiple hats to meet mission needs. Join us as we uncover new capabilities that will grow our SmallSAT business line.
More about your role:
You will have the opportunity to contribute to a small team responsible for evaluating large, complex datasets by developing scripts, basic tools and visualizations to quantify key performance metrics and identify unusual behaviors in our systems. Being comfortable working in a dynamic environment with changing mission needs and priorities that requires collaborating across contracts and working with customers will add to your success. Work will be conducted at the NASK Aurora, Colorado offices.
Required Qualifications:
Minimum 4 years of Analyst experience
Familiarity with communications signals, demodulation and analysis
Experience using Python to evaluate large datasets (requirement)
Data Analysis
Experience using statistics to describe data and quantify system performance
Experience working with large complex datasets
System analysis experience
Comfortable in dynamic environments
Good communication skills, comfortable presenting data and working as a part of a team
Domain knowledge of Emitter Mapping
Preferred Qualifications:
SmallSAT experience
General knowledge of spacecraft subsystems, orbital dynamics, and ground systems
Working knowledge of Telemetry, Tracking and Commanding (TT&C) and Ground Control (GC) applications
Small satellite technical knowledge
Experience working in an operational environment
Capability to identify system issues and provide technical advice
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Who we are:
Our people are the core of who we are and what we do. NASK has two decades of experience delivering innovative solutions to the tough technical challenges facing our partners in the Intelligence and Defense communities. Our subject matter experts collaborate with junior developers and analysts, bringing fresh approaches to solve the toughest mission problems.
Benefits:
At NASK, our employees are the backbone of our company, so we provide unsurpassed benefits and work-life balance. Employees are provided with individual offices and collaboration spaces to foster individual and team success. We have a casual yet professional work environment – Employees work hard, and NASK offers a competitive benefits package that equates to 50% on top of your annual base salary. This is split between a tax-qualified profit-sharing retirement plan that NASK contributes to (up to allowable IRS limits) and a cafeteria plan for benefits. For a comprehensive overview of our benefits, visit the benefits tab under our careers page: https://nask.world/company/careers/
Compensation:
NASK Incorporated considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to the role and responsibilities, work experience, education, training, certifications, geographic location, and market data. These are general guidelines and not a guarantee of compensation or salary.
Please be aware that many of our positions require the ability to obtain or maintain a U.S security clearance which requires U.S citizenship.

National Center for Missing & Exploited Children
3.6
Description:
TITLE: Analyst I, Missing Child & Data Analytics Team (MCDAT)
FLSA: Exempt
DIVISION: Analytical Services Division (ASD)
DEPARTMENT: Missing Child & Data Analytics Team

TRAVEL REQUIREMENT:
Ability to travel as needed (to attend conferences, training, etc.)

HOURS and SCHEDULE:
Monday – Friday, 9:00am to 5:30pm (37.5 hours within five (5) days per week); assume on-call duties and work evening and weekend shifts on a rotating basis as needed unless otherwise required or approved by management.

SUPERVISION RECEIVED:
Works under the general supervision of the Program Manager of the Missing Child & Data Analytics Team

SUPERVISION EXERCISED:
None

RESPONSIBILITY FOR PUBLIC CONTACT:
Daily contact requiring courtesy, discretion, and sound judgment

LICENSING AND CERTIFICATION:
Must be eligible to apply for VCIN certification which requires either U.S. citizenship or having been a lawful resident of the U.S. for the past 10 consecutive years. Must obtain VCIN certification within three (3) months of hire and maintain certification including completion of all required training. VCIN certification requires background screening, to include fingerprinting, criminal history check, and professional references.

GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
This position is responsible for supporting NCMEC staff and law enforcement agencies in their efforts to recover missing children, identify unidentified living and deceased children, and track attempted abductions.Analysts are responsible for reviewing, prioritizing and analyzing all leads received by NCMEC’s Call Center, bringing the best leads immediately to the attention of the case manager and law enforcement. Analysts also utilize online searches and public source databases in an effort to enhance information already known about a subject or to develop new information that may lead to the recovery of a missing child.

The content of reports may involve written materials and images that reference or detail crimes against children or adults to include child abduction, child sexual exploitation, violence, child homicide and unidentified human remains believed to be children.Such assistance requires an employee that can handle exposure to sensitive content as well as demonstrate a high level of accuracy and thoroughness in their work product.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
This position requires the ability to access and use NCIC/Nlets data after successfully completing VCIN certification.
Provide technical assistance to both internal and external requestors by conducting searches of NCMEC databases, online resources, and public record databases.
Compile information, establish timelines, analyze findings, make interpretations, and write comprehensive reports to be delivered to NCMEC case managers and law enforcement.
Review infile and not infile leads received on a daily basis and alert case managers and law enforcement agencies of these leads in a timely manner.
Search to identify possible incidents of attempted abductions of children, analyze these incidents, and disseminate a bi-weekly summary report to law enforcement electronically via an email listserv.
Establish a network of internal and external contacts to identify trends, conduct analysis, and work on specific projects or cases involving missing or unidentified children.
Make sound judgment calls that will aid in the location, recovery, and reunification of missing or abducted children.
Assume on-call duties on a rotating basis to assist law enforcement and NCMEC staff with emergency/time sensitive search requests during non-business hours.
Prepare summaries of success stories to be distributed to corporate partners, NCMEC staff, and law enforcement professionals.
Provide Team status report at Division meetings on a rotating basis.
Provide tours and demos to new NCMEC employees and external visitors.
Projects, as assigned, may also include searches to identify possible incidents of attempted abductions of children, coordination with ASD interns to enter confirmed incidents into the database, analysis of incidents, and dissemination of a bi-monthly summary report to law enforcement electronically via an email listserv.
Promote and exhibit loyalty to the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children and the cause of protecting children worldwide.
Promote a professional image.
Communicate with co-workers, management, Law Enforcement officials, and others in a courteous and professional manner.
Conform with and abide by all regulations, policies, work procedures, and instructions.
Respond promptly when returning telephone calls and replying to correspondence.
Other duties as assigned.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree in Criminal Justice or a related field.
Two years related work or internship experience preferred.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Analytical background in law enforcement with an emphasis on analyzing criminal activity or similar related experience analyzing missing children’s cases.
Must possess skills and experience in collecting and analyzing information to produce assessments and reports.
Strong familiarity with all popular social media platforms.
Ability to handle and maintain the integrity and confidentiality of highly sensitive material and information.
Ability to work on-call and a flexible schedule to include afternoon, weekend, and evening hours as needed.
Skilled in the use of Windows-based operating systems.
Excellent verbal, telephone, and written communications skills.
Ability to prioritize workload and meet deadlines.
Adaptability, flexibility and ability to work as part of a team or in an individual capacity.
Ability to travel as needed (to attend conferences, training, etc.).
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
The National Center for Missing and Exploited Children is an EO employer - M/F/Veteran/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity.

Employer Name:
Volunteers of America Chesapeake and Carolinas

Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Volunteers of America Chesapeake & Carolinas empowers self-reliance and inspires hope. As a church without walls, we do this through personalized housing, ministry, health, and human services that benefit vulnerable individuals, their families and the community. Founded in 1896 in Baltimore, MD by social reformers, Ballington and Maud Booth, we were one of the first of over 30 affiliates of Volunteers of America – one of the nation’s largest and most comprehensive human services organizations.
Our founders envisioned a movement dedicated to reaching and uplifting the American people. On behalf of the organization, the Booths pledged “to go wherever we are needed, and do whatever comes to hand”. Their declaration continues to guide Volunteers of America's impact on “Helping America’s most vulnerable”.

Through a dedicated and committed team of more than 850 employees and thousands of volunteers, we provide critical care, support services and hope to thousands of people each year throughout Virginia, Maryland, the District of Columbia and the Carolinas. We firmly believe our employees drive the success of the organization. Through our diversity, equity and inclusion efforts, we endeavor to attract, engage and retain qualified, diverse, compassionate individuals to join our journey and experience a work environment that offers challenging, stimulating and financially rewarding opportunities.

Business Analyst Associate
About Koalafi
We're one of the fastest growing consumer finance companies in America. Why? We're making it simpler, faster, and more transparent to purchase the things you need to make your life go.
By combining smarter technology with a relentless focus on customer experience, we're transforming the financing experience for essential life purchases in retail stores nationwide.
About the Opportunity
Koalafi is in a period of transformative growth and looking to expand into Enterprise Sales. We are attacking this with a unique value proposition for our largest merchants in the form of a differentiated set of financial products that allows us to put the right payment plan in front of each customer.
As a business analyst, you will partner directly with our sales and product teams to support this initiative.
Your responsibilities will include:
Drive research and analysis that powers our strategy, operational, financial, and business development decision-making.
Develop business plans, including gathering requirements for transformational projects within our sales & product organizations.
Create and maintain our reporting infrastructure to measure and drive business performance.
Produce financial models and NPV analyses.
About You
You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, entrepreneurial environment.
You have the versatility and intellectual curiosity to work across functional groups.
You are an effective thought partner and can think both practically and creatively.
You have existing proficiency in or the ability to quickly learn a database language (SQL) or programming language (Python, R, etc.).
You have 0 to 2+ years of experience in a quantitative field and/or quantitative degree (preferred - finance, economics, mathematics, engineering, etc.).
Things we value:
Curiosity. Why? How?
Nerdiness. Financial news and trends are fascinating. Seriously.
Relentlessness. No one here gives up. We try. We fail. We try again.
Passion. If you don't get excited about point of sale financing, retail, and consumer empowerment, it simply won't work.
Smarts: Book and street. We have to use all of the tools at our disposal to build Koalafi.
Empathy and Compassion.You understand that people's access to life essential goods and services are in your hands.
Communication. Can you ask for help or put your hand up when you don't understand?
Building. Doing. Making. Yes, we have to do a lot of thinking and talking to figure this stuff out, but you can't wait to leave the conversation and build it.

Overview:
INTECON, LLC is seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst II to join its team in support of the FEMA Office of National Continuity Programs (ONCP) Business Management Division (BMD) . The selected candidate will be responsible for providing critical support to the BMD's five major areas of responsibility, including Budget and Financial Management, Acquisitions Management, Human Resources Administration, Asset Management, and Portfolio Oversight.
Key Responsibilities:
Conduct quantitative and qualitative data analysis to support BMD operations and decision-making processes.
Develop and maintain data systems, tools, and processes to collect, store, and analyze data related to BMD operations and performance.
Design and conduct surveys, assessments, and evaluations to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement in BMD operations.
Collaborate with BMD stakeholders to identify data needs and develop appropriate data solutions to support their business requirements.
Generate reports and presentations that effectively communicate data insights and findings to BMD stakeholders.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of BMD operations, policies, and procedures, as well as the broader context of ONCP's mission and objectives.
Assist in developing manageable budget milestones aligning with FEMA and DHS goals. Milestones shall be aligned with DHS-wide earned value management (EVM) guidelines related to cost accounting and financial management.
Assist in budget formulation and execution, with analysts supporting division portfolios.
Assist in Event Tracking and Approval (ETA) and Travel Submission Management
Aid in package review, approval, and email through Enterprise Coordination Approvals Processing System (ECAPS) tracking and approval
Provides support for developing status of funds and briefing charts.
Assists in preparing required OCFO quarterly and annual Undelivered Order Obligation (UDO) reconciliation requirements.
File and store all documentation according to the FMB configuration management plan and file record system.
Assist in creating, processing, and following through on financial documentation for knowledge management and auditing authorities.
Assist in the creation of FMB-related PowerPoint presentations (*proficient in all Microsoft Software applications) (Senior Level preferred).
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in operations research, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field; Master's degree preferred.
At least 7 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a government or military context.
Strong analytical skills, including proficiency in statistical analysis, data modeling, and visualization tools.
Experience with database design and management, data collection, and data cleaning.
Familiarity with data analysis programming languages (e.g., Python, R) and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI).
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to effectively present data insights to a non-technical audience.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Active Top Secret Clearance
Experience supporting FEMA desired

Employer Name:
Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP

Description:
Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP is a leading international law firm with more than 900 lawyers in offices throughout the United States, Europe, Asia and the Middle East. We are currently seeking an Information Security Analyst in our Information Technology department, reporting directly to the Information Security Manager.
The position can reside in the Dallas, Houston, Los Angeles, Philadelphia or Washington, DC office, with hybrid work capabilities, and will be responsible for designing and implementing IT security systems to protect the organization's computer networks from cyber attacks. The Information Security Analyst will also help develop organization wide best practices for IT security. It will also monitor computer networks for security issues, install security software and document all security issues or breaches you find.
Key responsibilities of this position include:
Assists in the planning and execution of vulnerability scans of organization information systems.
Analyzes data from threat and vulnerability feeds along with patch management results and analyzes data for applicability to the organization.
Generates reports on assessment findings and summarizes to facilitate remediation tasks.
Implements and coordinates remediation steps across technical verticals and develops and implements plans to prevent recurring vulnerabilities.
Effectively works across teams to remediate issues – perpetually reducing threat landscape.
Refines focus – tool tuning of the Vulnerability scanning tool.
Adheres to applicable Information Security Policies and Procedures.
Monitors remediation progress and updates tracking mechanisms accordingly; keeps monitoring software/systems up-to-date.
Interface with internal stakeholders on vulnerability management issues.
Stays current on emerging threats and associated remediation steps as well as the ever changing information security world.
Ensures compliance with all applicable configuration standards.
Manages enterprise vulnerability assessment and configuration assessment reports as well as patch management reports.
Identifies and resolves false positive findings in assessment results.
Documents exceptions and gains stakeholder approvals as required by policy.
Performs compensating controls analysis and validates efficacy of existing controls.
Recommends security controls and/or corrective actions for mitigating technical and business risk.
Produces vulnerability, configuration, and coverage metrics and reporting to demonstrate assessment coverage and remediation effectiveness against the standards.
Qualifications (Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities):
Associate’s Degree or comparable technical school certifications preferred
Knowledge of scripting languages preferred but not required
Demonstrable knowledge of industry standards
Experience with vulnerability scanning processes and programs such as Nessus, Security Center or similar scanning systems
Technical expertise in system security vulnerabilities and remediation
Knowledge of network and web-related protocols such as TCP/IP, UDP, HTTP, IPSEC, etc.
Strong analytical, estimating and problem solving skills
Excellent communication, interpersonal and collaboration skills
Ability to present and explain technical information to diverse audiences
Ability to be flexible, adaptable and learn new concepts quickly
Ability to work effectively in a team environment with aggressive deadlines and multiple priorities
Familiarity with project management methodologies
Experience in producing enterprise level reports, compiling data from different sources.
Experience with processes involving problem identification, recovery, escalation and resolution
Able to function well in a fast-paced and adaptive environment
Commitment to maintaining confidentiality of client and office information and adhering to the Firm’s Core Values
Commitment to professional growth and development
The base salary range for this position in California is $75,000 to $100,000. Additional information about benefits and rewards can be found here.

Job Description:
Dewberry is currently seeking a Data Analyst for our Fairfax, VA office.

Candidates MUST be US Citizens to be eligible for this position.

Dewberry’s Geospatial and Technology Services creates geospatial and analytical solutions for real-world engineering, environmental, and community problems. Our analysts perform a variety of data services for our clients including data management, governance, analysis, transformation, automation, and visualization.

Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors are our people. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. Whether you’re an experienced professional or a new graduate, you’ll have the chance to collaborate with the best and brightest and work on innovative and complex projects at the forefront of the industry. Our commitment to excellence stems from our personal integrity and from other defining attributes, which we call “Dewberry at Work,” that have inspired our employees to be successful for more than a half-century.
Responsibilities:
Candidates will have strong competencies and demonstrated experience developing data management, analysis, and visualization solutions with an emphasis on business analytics. Work assignments will be varied to include:
Work on consulting projects for government and commercial clients.
Support large scale geospatial analytical modeling efforts to identify hazards, assess risk, and evaluate risk reduction methods.
Apply statistical, numerical and/or computer application techniques.
Develop web, mobile, and desktop applications.
Participate in testing, supporting and deploying tools and preparing technical documentation
Required Skills & Required Experience:
Necessary background and skills include:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business, GIS or other relevant geospatial or data science related field, masters preferred.
At least 2 years’ experience working with data management and analysis applications
Intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate, Sharepoint, and ArcGIS Pro.
Excellent problem-solving, verbal and written communication, design development, and debugging skills.
Ability to work independently using strong organizational skills and operate effectively in team settings using an agile software development approach.
Maintain and support application(s) according to changing business/mission requirements.
Ability to deploy to client sites for up to 90 days at a time for a total 6 months a year.
Don’t meet every single requirement? At Dewberry we are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace for our employees. So if you’re excited about this role, but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the position description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may just be the right candidate for this or other opportunities.

At this time, Dewberry will not sponsor a new applicant for work authorization.
Dewberry is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

These screenings will be conducted by Dewberry’s background vendor of choice and will be conducted in compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local law.

Job Description:
Position: Associate Data Analyst
Location: Reston, VA

Per Executive Order 14042, new or prospective Comscore, Inc. employees in the United States, must provide proof of complete vaccination, or approved exemption on the first day of their employment.

About This Role:

The Associate Data Analyst is responsible for extracting, transforming, and analyzing data, finding insights and answering questions about the content of the data. Performs analytical hypothesis testing and modeling to provide key insight to internal and external clients. Supports sales function by providing data expertise, feasibility reviews, and detailed analysis of questions raised by internal and external stakeholders. More senior roles are involved in the creation and innovation of Comscores offerings to the marketplace and are responsible for managing and leading cross-functional teams of analysts. Some roles create and maintain internal and external user interface and reporting tools. These roles cross all Comscore product areas, including digital, mobile, OTT, and TV.

What You'll Do:
Extracts, transforms and analyzes data
Owns discrete research tasks
Interprets data and reports key findings to internal and external clients
Assists in the development of automating and streamlining custom work using ETL software and database query tools
Works cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data quality issues
Performs QA checks on custom work created by team
Troubleshoots data collection issues
Writes complex SQL
Responsible for established and reoccurring custom analysis projects
Escalates issues when appropriate
Manages time appropriately in order to meet internal and external deadlines
Documents report production and quality control processes
What You'll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Decision Sciences, Economics, Physics, Mathematics, or related field.
0-2+ years of professional experience
Proficient in statistical software (i.e. SQL), relational databases and MS Office Suite
Uses database query tools and ELT software (SQL, Python, Alteryx, Qlik, etc.)
Experience analyzing data sets
Strong analytic, statistical and quantitative skills
About Comscore
At Comscore, we’re pioneering the future of cross-platform media measurement, arming organizations with the insights they need to make decisions with confidence. Central to this aim are our people who work together to simplify the complex on behalf of our clients & partners. Though our roles and skills are varied, we’re united by our commitment to five underlying values: Integrity, Velocity, Accountability, Teamwork, and Servant Leadership. If you’re motivated by big challenges and interested in helping some of the largest and most important media properties and brands navigate the future of media, we’d love to hear from you.

Comscore (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a trusted partner for planning, transacting and evaluating media across platforms. With a data footprint that combines digital, linear TV, over-the-top and theatrical viewership intelligence with advanced audience insights, Comscore allows media buyers and sellers to quantify their multiscreen behavior and make business decisions with confidence. A proven leader in measuring digital and set-top box audiences and advertising at scale, Comscore is the industry’s emerging, third-party source for reliable and comprehensive cross-platform measurement. To learn more about Comscore, please visit Comscore.com.

EEO Statement: We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

To comply with federal law, Comscore participates in E-Verify. Successful candidates must pass the E-Verify process after hire.

Navient’s wholly owned subsidiary Xtend Healthcare is seeking qualified professionals to fulfill a specific need at one of our key clients of EY (Ernst & Young). These full-time Navient Xtend Healthcare employee positions offer flexibility, attractive pay including premium-paid overtime, and an attractive benefits package (e.g., heavily subsidized insurance, significant paid time off, and matching 401k funding).
THIS IS A FULL-TIME REMOTE POSITION.
Our Healthcare Data Analyst employees have data analytics, informatics, or business backgrounds. They assist EY’s clients in complying with Medicare, Medicaid, and other regulatory requirements, in addition to helping them receive the appropriate amount of reimbursement from these programs. These positions work with EY’s proprietary tools to analyze large volumes of hospital data. The candidates must employ various technical data manipulation techniques to analyze large complex data sets, identify data patterns, data mine, etc. Through training, candidates must learn and apply relevant regulations to compile data sets. Candidates must be able to communicate results of the analysis to project managers.
These positions offer a highly flexible working environment. For those living near Indianapolis, Indiana, professionals have the opportunity to work partially in the office and remotely.
Regardless of work location, professionals will work with EY’s national healthcare reimbursement hub professionals, most of whom are based out of the Indianapolis, Indiana office. Applicants need not live near Indianapolis and may work remotely within the United States, although occasional travel to EY’s Indianapolis office may be required. EY is a globally recognized professional services firm and its Indianapolis healthcare consulting practice serves a variety of healthcare clients nationally. Navient Xtend Healthcare through EY offers our team members a highly inclusive, flexible work environment. Benefits also include the opportunity to develop and build upon deep technical skills and develop healthcare industry and consulting knowledge through on-the-job training. The EY assignment is long-term with no scheduled end date. Many employees have been assigned to EY for multiple years, some well over fifteen years through retirement. Some individuals do occasionally travel to client sites for work, but travel is not required by most.
JOB SUMMARY:
1. Analyze large volumes of hospital data.
2. Employ various techniques to analyze large complex data sets:
a. Data manipulation
b. Dana mining
c. Identifying data patterns
3. Learn and apply relevant regulations to compile data sets.
4. Communicate results of analysis succinctly to project managers.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Data Analytics, Finance, Accounting, Actuarial Science, or a related field (required)
Intermediate level proficiency with Microsoft Excel (required), with Microsoft Access, SQL, or other database software experience (recommended)
Successful reference check, background check and drug screening (required)
Acute attention to detail and strong analytical skills (required)
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to employ critical thinking skills and work independently while also working well within a team environment
Receptiveness to differing views and ideas with the ability to apply industry-specific concepts
Highly adaptable to changing circumstances and/or directives in day-to-day priorities
Ability to perform well on frequent repetitive tasks while continually improving skills and competencies
Willingness to travel occasionally (plus)

ou will combine analytical, artistic and technological skills to produce graphics for news content and other Bloomberg Industry Group products. You will collaborate with other analysts and reporters on the team to help our clients navigate the complex policy and legislative landscape in Washington.

As a successful small business, we recognize that our employees are our most valuable resource. Program Communications Analyst
Location: Washington, DC, National Capital Region
Clearance: Top Secret, Active, required with ability to obtain and maintain SCI
Candidates with a Director of Central Intelligence Directive (DCID) 6/4 eligibility within the last five (5) years are highly preferred.
Employment Type: This position will be contingent on contract award.
Position Summary
This position provides technical, analytical and communications specialized support to the Office of the Assistant Secretary of Defense for Research and Engineering (OASD(R&E)) and the Office of the Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Research (ODASD(R)). Daily operations would include coordination with multiple government agencies for the purpose of effectively and successfully preparing communications packages, messages, memo and technical reports. .
Individuals serving in this position support programs through research and analysis to create information about technical processes or products directed to multi-agency stakeholders through various forms of written or media materials. Communication analysts support senior Defense executive with products or documents addressing technical or specialized topics covering the breadth of DOD research and engineering programs.
It is preferred the candidate possess thorough knowledge of the DoD infrastructure and procedures. Candidates in this position will be expected to meet all OSD mandated timelines for submission of program, budgeting or project execution related documents.
Primary Duties:
Develop decision-quality materials to meet communications, understanding or program characterization statements for in-process review meetings and briefings.
Construct briefs and talking points for use by the ODASD(R) leadership
Compose, refine and edit clear language or persuasive language in support of directorate leadership, activities and reporting
Analyze products and processes to improve communications, recommend or adapt new processes or integrate more adroit editing and review procedures
Conceive solutions and provide written materials, often in response to short-notice tasks assigned to the ODASD(R).
Coordinate and review official correspondence and presentation materials
Perform technical editing at various levels from technical program reporting to final review of senior executive position statements, testimonies or presentations
Develop key communications and messaging supporting ODASD(R) media interaction.
Provide direction to successfully aggregate, review and verify draft component inputs for congressional testimony and responses to questions for the record-.
Organize, develop, and direct support for senior leadership activities to issue paper preparation, results documentation, and post-meeting actions.
Support activities, meetings, and projects with the development of meeting agendas, management plans, and execution strategies
Research and analyze data to support content development of papers, action memos, programs responses or status statements and presentations
Assist with execution strategies of S&T initiatives
Coordinate with participating government organizations and agencies on technical reports, products or program packages (e.g., Defense Technical Information Center)
Develop outreach strategies to incentivize industry and users to foster participation
Compile status updates and metrics to support discussion with senior leaders.
Prepare official presentations, information and action memos, concept papers, official responses to public correspondence; and articles for the ODASD(R) website.
Track Congressional marks and language on resources, products and programs
Deliver research, technical and analytical support by identifying, retrieving, evaluating, and sharing relevant legislative information.
Develop and coordinate responses and reports to congressional inquiries and legal requirements pertaining to the DoD Research and Engineering projects.
Prepare official program documents and correspondences based on the ODASD(R) input and direction
Perform research, information, and reference-gathering on assigned topics
Apply ongoing and responsive superior editorial skills to various documents
Conceive, construct, and disseminate implementation status reports and program metrics to support discussion with senior leaders.
Support and attend DoD S&T leadership committee meetings
Develop overall program presentation materials and provide administrative assistance and logistics
Maintain, file and properly disseminate meeting minutes
Qualifications:
Five years proven experience providing exceptional oral and written communication skills, and above-average skills in MS Word, PowerPoint, and Excel applications.
Proven senior editing skills and editing process management
Five years demonstrated experience in supporting S&T programs in DoD and knowledge of Defense S&T activities, organizations, plans and processes.
Ability to coordinate across large groups of people at multiple levels.
Education:
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in a technical field or business administration – Required
Master's degree in Business Administration (MBA), or a graduate degree in communications, technology, mathematics, or other related field –(Preferred)
Degree requirement waived for recent and relevant work experience: minimum of five years' active-duty military or minimum of 10 years' experience.
Travel:
Occasional travel may be required.
This full-time position is Monday through Friday and operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. Limited travel may be required.
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position.
While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear.
The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.
This position requires the ability to occasionally lift office products and supplies, up to 20 pounds.

Provide ad-hoc support to IT Chiefs and managers as needed

Other Functions
Tracks, monitors, controls, and reports on proposed major departmental activities and projects at a high-level to ensure all communications are properly conveyed
Performs detailed fact gathering, data compilation, analysis and report writing on budgets, organizations, personnel staffing, operations, and administrative systems
Stays current with emerging trends and technologies and tools; makes recommendations for new tools and technologies, as necessary
Develops and maintains documentation, ensuring all information is accurate and current
Performs other related duties as assigned

Business casual office setting

Required Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities
Extensive knowledge of the principles and methods of data collection, analysis and compilation
Ability to write clear concise reports, memoranda, directives, and letters
Ability to develop clear and concise department metrics reports
Ability to develop solutions leading to intuitive understanding of a concept or idea
Ability to plan, assign and coordinate the work of others
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external contacts
Ability to effectively communicate complex information to technical and non-technical audiences
Skill in collecting IT department metrics and reporting

Job Title: Data Scientist/Fraud Data Analyst - Dept of Justice
Description:
Cambio Consulting Group LLC is seeking to hire a full-time Data Scientist/Fraud data analytics for a long-term contract with the Criminal Division of the U.S. Department of Justice. The position will be focused on generating and supporting investigations into government related health care fraud. Minimum requirement of a Bachelor's Degree and 5+ years of experience. The position requires familiarity with Medicare, Medicaid, insurance and health care payments and transactions.
Must have good understanding in building data analytics programs and programming languages such as: SQL, Excel, SAS, Python, R, C+ or Java.
We require a Data Scientist to work closely with Trial Attorneys and Law Enforcement agents. The Data Scientist will pull, normalize, and smash data from multiple data sources (including government, external, and health care systems), develop and apply learning algorithms to assist in the analysis of the data, and build user interface and user workflows for attorneys and agents to gain insight.
In addition, the Data Scientist will be expected to provide expert advice and recommendations, summarize findings in reports and presentations, and lead training sessions to teach others how to use the available data sources to perform quantitative and qualitative analysis.
TASKS:
1. Designing, deploying, and scaling analytical products with a multi-skilled team to deliver the right insights to the right people at the right time.
2. Creating and executing a clear data and governance roadmap within a defined budget .
3. Overseeing technical development of software/analytics platforms and including process assurance and validation of the results.
4. Smashing disparate data sets to assist business users in finding insights and actionable intelligence.
5. Building environments conducive to the application of machine learning and artificial intelligence.
6. Building user-focused platforms for users with minimal technical experience.
7. Communicating to business owners without technical expertise and be part of a team that will tackle complex data challenges.
8. Flexibility to assist in ad hoc projects as needs arise.
Key Skills
1. Ability to determine the appropriate sources of information, and techniques to analyze a wide variety of trading data including performing statistical analysis; experience managing and working with large data sets.
2. Substantial experience working with relevant data analytics programs and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Excel, SAS, Python, R, C#, Java); experience with data visualization and presentation.
3. Exceptional organizational and strong written communication skills.
4. Proven ability to multi-task and problem solve.
5. Active Public Trust Clearance or ability to obtain clearance.
6. Data visualization (e.g. Tableau / Spotfire).
7. Architecture (HIVE).
8. Statistical Modelling.
9. Financial Analysis and experience with accounting/ERP systems.
10. Agile/SCRUM.
11. Cybersecurity.

· SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle Model)
· Certified Public Accountant or Fraud Examiner
· Artificial Intelligence/ Machine Learning
· Federated Learning / Differential Privacy
GATING REQUIREMENTS:

2. Must have Top Secret Clearance or eligibility to obtain one.
3. Ability to determine the appropriate sources of information as well as techniques to analyze a wide variety of trading data, to include performing statistical analysis; experience managing and working with large data sets
4. Substantial experience working with relevant data analytics programs and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Excel, SAS, Python, R, C#, Java); experience with data visualization and presentation
